We're made up of proactive, independent teams that have the freedom to do what they think is best for their players, our games, and the company.We know it takes more than trust and independence to make great games, so we also take good care of our people, providing them with the compensation, work environment and resources they need to succeed and have fun while at it.Read MoreYou Are Not Your Job TitleWorking with us means you won't need to focus on chasing titles or climbing ladders. We've decided that our internal job titles don't include prefixes like senior, junior, principal, or director. Instead, we embrace our non-hierarchical culture, allowing us to concentrate on what truly matters: doing what's best for our players. Recognition isn't tied to your job title, nor does your title define the impact you can have.For hiring purposes, we do use industry-standard job titles to help attract talent. When it comes to public-facing spaces like LinkedIn, we trust and encourage everyone to select a title that feels most appropriate for them.Read MoreThis position is in Helsinki, but you're not?Luckily, moving to Helsinki is easier than you might think. No matter where you would be moving from, our dedicated people will help you from beginning to end. We're here to ensure the process is as smooth as possible for you, your family and whoever and whatever you bring along. In addition to cats and dogs, we've even relocated a horse.Read MoreNot sure if you should apply?Do it! You might feel like you don't tick all the listed requirements with stellar scores. That's fine! We're here to help you succeed. Also, we're happy to learn about any specific accommodations you might require to fully engage in our recruitment process.And here's a video about what we do. (Best enjoyed with salmiakki and rye bread)

title: Senior Data Engineer Snsit
description: BrieflyPositionSenior Data EngineerLocationHelsinki or TampereSkillsData architecture, data engineering, cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP), databases, data pipelines, software engineering (e.g. Python, Scala, Clojure)KuvausAre you passionate about data engineering and data architecture? Would you like to build solutions that create actual business value? At Nitor, we help our clients to succeed with data.🧑‍🚀Your future roleAs a Senior Data Engineer at Nitor, your aim is to help our customers extract business value from data with a pragmatic approach, focusing on solving their challenges with the right tools. Your responsibilities might include creating data-intensive applications, automating and orchestrating data pipelines, and simplifying complex technical entities into more common-sense solutions.Communication with the customer is crucial, and training our customer’s experts to use and maintain the provided solution is also an intriguing part of your job.Our customer projectsare typically challenging yet professionally rewarding. The projects provide an experienced Senior Data Engineer with the possibility to widely utilize and deepen their skill set. The duration of the projects usually ranges between one year and multiple years, depending on your preferences. Our data business unit Nitor Insight, established in 2018, is a tight-knit and startup-like community with an exceptionally high level of data know-how.✅ What makes you successful as a Senior Data Engineer at Nitor?Several years of previous work experience in software development (we often work with Python, sometimes you might encounter Scala or Clojure in a client project). Consulting experience is a bonus but not a strict requirement.Experience of cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, and/or GCP) and relational databasesMastering the tools needed to create data-intensive applications (e.g. Spark, Kafka)Ability to automate and manage data pipelines and simplify complex technical entities into more common-sense solutionsYou possess a consultative and customer-centric mindsetProfessional proficiency in Finnish is considered an advantageMost importantly: you are passionate about data engineering, and you actively follow the newest developments in the industry🏆 Why should you choose Nitor?A set of benefits that makes a differenceIn addition to meaningful projects and customized possibilities for professional development, we offer you a profound set of employee benefits. Nitor is built in a way that it can support your career development, sustainable work pace, and well-being.Here are some examples of our employee benefits:You can use 10% of your work time for your professional development however you choose, and your employer will support it.Would you like to participate in an exciting event in your field? You can use up to five workdays a year for training or conference trips anywhere in the world.You will have your personal, monthly updated "iron bank" consisting of 7.100€ which you can freely use to acquire preferred work tools and home office supplies.You will get full holidays from the beginning of your employment, no matter what time of the year you start.Full culture and sports benefits, massage benefit, and commuting and bicycle benefitsA 500-2000€ bonus for each professional certificate you completeAn extensive set of health benefits with health insurance, covering special healthcare, dental care, and psychological support, among othersWe cherish our sense of community with our yearly employee trips (we have been, e.g., to Pisa, Berlin, Vienna, Edinburgh, and Dubrovnik, as well as the skiing centers of the North), seasonal events, and weekly get-togethers and breakfasts. You're welcome to join our running club, wine tasting, movie nights, HIIT training, or board game club, among others!Our way of working is grounded in trust, openness, and mutual respect; each Nitorean brings their unique quality to the company. We value and cherish our differences and the added value this brings to our customers.About your future employerAt Nitor, we don’t just build digital solutions; we create lasting success stories in collaboration with our clients. Sustainability is at the heart of our approach, ensuring that the systems, communities, environments, and processes we develop stand the test of time. This is what we call sustainable digital development.Our 250+ experts operate across Helsinki, Tampere, and Stockholm, combining diverse talents to deliver meaningful impact. Recognized as a Great Place to Work and awarded Finland’s Most Magnetic Employer Brand (read more), we take pride in our employee-driven culture and genuine commitment to our people's growth. We don’t just work together; we grow together. Your ideas and expertise will have a real impact, shaping both Nitor’s future and your career.Our vision is clear: to be the top choice for professionals in the field, driven by the happiness and empowerment of our people and customers. As a benchmark for customer satisfaction in the IT industry, Nitor continues to achieve growth and deliver outstanding customer results (read how dedication fuels our growth).🏖Nitor's recruitment processOur recruitment process reflects our values and is a clear dialogue with four stages. You will have the possibility to meet at least four Nitoreans during the process. We offer you everything you need to know when deciding on your next workplace.1. Get to know Nitor: We map what is most important to you in your career. Our People Partner and our Principal Data Scientist / Managing Director will tell you about Nitor, our projects, and what your work at Nitor could look like.2. A technical interview: You will meet two of our consultants, who will form an understanding of the strengths and extent of your expertise. You will also gain first-hand knowledge of our projects and Nitor as an employer.3. Open questions: We double-check that you have all the answers to your possible questions. We specify your future role at Nitor and prepare the basis for your upcoming job offer.4. Presenting the offerSounds promising? Would you like to join our community of data professionals, coders, designers, and agile coaches and get to enjoy a creative and bureaucracy free working culture? Submit your application, let us know why Nitor and consulting would be an interesting next career step for you, and let's talk more!Also, please note that you will need to be authorized to work in Finland or Sweden in order to proceed in our recruitment process.Nitorilla äänesi kuullaanNitor haluaa tarjota tekijöilleen parhaan mahdollisen paikan kasvaa ja kehittyä alansa ammattilaisena. Nitorilla saat olla oma itsesi ja rakennat urapolkusi osaamisen ja kiinnostuksesi mukaan.Haastavat työtehtävät ja työkavereiden sparraus ylläpitävät oppimisen iloa. Voit osallistua myös kiinnostaviin koulutuksiin, tapahtumiin ja konferensseihin Nitorin tukemana. Halutessasi pääset käyttämään työaikaa uusien asioiden opiskeluun, Nitorin kehittämiseen organisaationa tai vaikka yleistä hyvää edistäviin projekteihin.Suomen ja Euroopan parhaimpien työpaikkojen joukkoon useana vuonna valittu Nitor on sitoutunut kehittämään kulttuuriaan jatkuvasti paremmaksi yhdessä. Läpinäkyvyys on tärkeimpiä työtämme ohjaavia tapojamme - meillä äänesi kuullaan.Lisää kysymyksiä?Laita viesti People Partner Ella Raskilalle. Hän vastaa sinua askarruttaviin kysymyksiin. Emme rekrytoi massoja, vaan yksilö kerrallaan. Niinpä jokainen rekrytointiprosessimme on myös yksilöllinen. Haluamme, että voit mutkattomasti tutustua Nitoriin ja löydät itsellesi oikean paikan.

title: Data Engineer Financial Data Services Sfsor
description: Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers' increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.We are looking for talented and passionate individuals to join our Secure Operations & Data Solutions unit! This role involves building in-going and out-going ETL processes between data systems, creating data models for Data Scientists, and assisting in feature engineering. You will also support in MLOps. Our team is committed to pursuing innovation and improvements through increased use of data. United by our passion for technology, curiosity about user experience, and dedication to excellence, we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.In this role, you will:Develop and maintain ETL processes and ensure that they follow the harmonized data model and that re-usage of ETL scripts is optimized.Ensure that ETL processes and reporting solutions follow and support the company data privacy and security guidelines.Ensure data correctness and high availability according to business needs.Support in deploying and maintaining Machine Learning models in production.Work according to company policies and instructions.Make sure that agreed deadlines are kept according to the work amount estimates made.This position can be located in either Espoo, Oslo, Kristiansand Solna or Gothenburg. At Fortum, we apply a hybrid working model. Read more about other job opportunities, our projects and what we offer here!To excel in this role, you are expected to be:A University degree holder in a relevant field.Experienced with 3-5 years of relevant experience in IT and business/industry.Experienced in practical Data Engineer work.Knowledgeable about Data platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and their main tools (Databricks, Data Lake, DataFactory, Delta Lake).Knowledgeable about databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle).Knowledgeable about SW version control tools.Experienced with ETL/ELT processes.We are excited to hire an individual who are passionate about data engineering and eager to contribute to our innovative team. If you share our enthusiasm, we would love to hear from you!Ready to Join Us?Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 20.03.2025 at the latest. We work with an ongoing selection and the job ad might be closed before the final application date. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Antti Heimonen by phone or via email at ***. We are here to help and look forward to hearing from you!To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.We are FortumFortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Senior Data Engineer Mlops Osaamisella Sasca
description: TehtävänkuvausSenior Data Engineerina et vastaa pelkästään koodaamisesta, vaan toimit asiantuntijana, joka ohjaa juniorimpien kehittäjien työtä ja varmistaa projektien onnistumisen. Kommunikoit suoraan asiakkaiden kanssa ymmärtääksesi heidän tarpeensa ja muuntaaksesi ne konkreettisiksi ratkaisuiksi. Roolisi on avainasemassa, kun rakennamme tehokkaita työnkulkuja ja tuotamme lisäarvoa asiakasprojekteissa.Työskentelet asiakasyrityksemme asiakasprojekteissa pääosin pääkaunpunkiseudulla.TarjoammeVakituisen työsuhteen Academic Workin konsulttina alansa johtavassa yrityksessä.Monipuoliset ja mielenkiintoiset asiakasprojektit, joissa kehität omaa asiantuntijuuttasi.TyötehtävätOhjata ja tukea juniorimpia kehittäjiä heidän työssään ja varmistaa laadukas toteutus.Kommunikoida suoraan asiakkaiden kanssa tarpeiden ymmärtämiseksi ja ratkaisujen suunnittelemiseksi.Suunnitella ja valvoa skaalautuvien dataputkien ja automatisoitujen työnkulkujen toteutusta.Osallistua koneoppimismallien tuotantoon viemiseen ja niiden suorituskyvyn optimointiin.Ylläpitää ja kehittää projektien työnkulkuja sekä tuoda uusia näkemyksiä tiimin työskentelyyn.Tehdä yhteistyötä eri sidosryhmien, kuten asiakkaiden ja sisäisten tiimien, kanssa sujuvan projektinhallinnan varmistamiseksi.EtsimmeAikaisempi vahva kokemus Data Engineer -roolissa tai vastaavissa tehtävissä asiakasprojekteista tai konsultoinnista.Kokemus MLOpsista, kuten mallien tuotantoon viemisestä ja CI/CD-putkien käytöstä.Kyky ohjata ja tukea juniorikehittäjiä sekä hallita kokonaisuuksia itsenäisesti.Hyvät viestintätaidot ja kyky kommunikoida asiakkaiden kanssa tehokkaasti.Ymmärrys prosessien ja työnkulkujen optimoinnista.Sujuva suomen ja englannin kielen taito.Arvostamme, jos sinulla onTuntemus pilvipalveluista (esim. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).Kokemus konttiteknologioista (esim. Docker, Kubernetes).Taitoa datan analysointiin ja mallintamiseen liittyvien työkalujen parissa (esim. Python, SQL, Spark).Osaamista voi hankkia opintojen, työkokemuksen tai itseopiskelun kautta.Menestyäksesi roolissa sinulla on:Johtamistaidot:Kyky ohjata ja inspiroida juniorikehittäjiä saavuttamaan tavoitteensa.Ongelmanratkaisukyky:Analyyttinen lähestymistapa monimutkaisiin haasteisiin ja kyky löytää toimivia ratkaisuja nopeasti.Vuorovaikutustaidot:Taito kommunikoida sujuvasti asiakkaiden ja tiimin kanssa teknisiä ja liiketoiminnallisia tarpeita yhdistäen.Joustavuus:Kyky mukautua muuttuvissa olosuhteissa ja omaksua uusia toimintatapoja.Proaktiivisuus:Halu ottaa vastuuta ja viedä asioita eteenpäin itsenäisesti.Kokonaisuuksien hahmottaminen:Kyky ymmärtää ja hallita projektien työnkulut alusta loppuun.Oppimishalu:Motivaatio kehittää itseään ja oppia uusia teknologioita tai menetelmiä tarpeen mukaan.Tiimipelaaja-asenne:Yhteistyökykyinen ja valmis tukemaan tiimiä tavoitteiden saavuttamisessa.RekrytointiprosessimmeAcademic Work hoitaa tätä hakua asiakkaansa puolesta, jonka toiveena on kaikkien tehtävää koskevien kysymysten osoittaminen Academic Workille.Hakijoita haastatellaan jatkuvasti ja mikäli olemme edenneet jo rekrytointiprosessissa pidemmälle, saatamme sulkea haun ennen lopullisia valintoja. Valintaprosessiin sisältyvät luonteenpiirteitä sekä kognitiivista kykyä mittaavat testit. Testit toimivat työkaluina oikean tekijän löytämiseksi tehtävään sekä takaavat tasa-arvoisen ja oikeudenmukaisen arvioinnin.Tehtävään valituille henkilöille tullaan suorittamaan turvallisuusselvitys projektien niin vaatiessa. Turvallisuusselvityksen läpäiseminen on ehto työsuhteen voimassaololle.

title: Senior Data Engineer Scsom
description: GPV is on a journey towards implementing a modern Data Platform and we want you to join us!Maybe you are currently working as a consultant but are tired of time registration and having to focus on five different projects at the same time? Or maybe you are stuck as an in-house developer at a place where things are standing still, and you feel like you being there doesn't make a difference? Then join GPV for a greenfield project where we are moving from a mix of on-prem technologies to a modern setup using Microsoft Fabric.Your roleAs a Data Engineer you will initially support our on-prem Microsoft data solutions, before transitioning into a key player in our future Fabric solution. Expect that your primary work the first 6 months will be focused on learning our legacy Microsoft platforms, taking over the responsibility from a colleague moving to a different IT position. The role will then be a split with approximately 50/50 time on maintaining and optimising the old platforms, and developing the new solution in Fabric with the knowledge you have gained in the first half year.GPV currently have several legacy ERP systems due to mergers, and your job is to secure reporting in the data platforms on top of these systems. Further we are in the process of rolling out D365FO with the first pilot site going live at the end of 2025. You will be an important part of this project, where the new Data Platform should contain the needed reporting at go-live. For both the existing and new platform you will be part of the complete process from requirement gathering with end-users, extracting source data, data modelling and building the cubes or semantic models in PowerBI.What we offerYou will be part of the team that transitions GPV into a digitized future, going from a complex setup with several different on-prem data platforms to a more streamlined setup in Microsoft Fabric.We offer a job where you can really make a difference and be challenged, while at the same time having fun with your colleagues.You will be offered a competitive salary that matches your qualifications and there are of course the standard things you would expect from the workplace, like mobile phone, internet provided at your home and a good canteen. Further there are social activities with local colleagues.To support learning there are possibilities to attend relevant conferences and take relevant certifications, to help your transition from the on-prem tech-stack to the Fabric experiences.We are looking for a senior data engineer with a relevant educational background and 5+ years of experience, with a focus on data solutions on the on-prem Microsoft tech-stack and an eager to learn new cloud tools together with skilled colleagues. You speak and communicate fluently in English.You are probably humble by nature and cannot checkoff all the requirements below, but hopefully there are a lot of known topics and you are able to quickly learn the rest because you are curious and like to explore.Microsoft T-SQL, with good knowledge of writing efficient SQL code, defining views and stored procedures, looking at execution plans, etc.SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), with hands-on experience of extracting data from different source systems, develop ELT logic and deployment to SQL servers, using the SQL Agent for orchestration and monitoring of nightly loadsSQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), having developed logic preferably both in tabular cubes (DAX) and multidimensional cubes (MDX)SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), with good understanding of how to build reports, deployment and access managementData Modelling, using SQL code and the Kimball methodology to build facts and dimensionsAzure DevOps, where Git repositories is a natural part of the development processCommunication skills, because your job is to collaborate with both the rest of the Data Team and in general with end-users in the business, in an international setupFurther it is beneficial if some of the following topics are also in your toolbelt:Microsoft PowerBI, building reports and the underlying semantic models (DAX), maybe utilizing external tools like Tabular EditorMicrosoft Fabric(excluding PowerBI), either hands-on from a project or self-learning with some of the components. Maybe you have or are planning to take the DP-600 certification.Azure Services, that are used in batch related data solutions (ADF, SQL, KeyVault, Storage Accounts, etc.)Power Platform, using Power Apps and Power Automate, both on its own and in combination with PowerBI reportsD365FO, understanding of the data model from the ERP system where you have preferably worked with data modelling and reporting on topGPV is an international company and the 3 members of the Data Team are located in 2 different countries. You will be working in a hybrid setup, partly from our office in Vantaa, Finland or Piestany, Slovakia and partly from home. We expect that the transportation from your place of residence to the office to be a maximum of 60 minutes. You will also cooperate with our external partners that support our journey, where they have provided the Fabric framework and needed support in the project.Learn more about GPV in our website: https://gpv-group.com/#LI-JH1

title: Senior Data Engineer Analytical Data Services Sfsor
description: Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers' increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.We are looking for talented and passionate individuals to join our Secure Operations & Data Solutions unit! This role involves overseeing data engineering activities in your responsibility area, such as Analytical Data Products. You will build data processing frameworks, work with data architects, and strive to continuously develop new and improved data engineering capabilities. Our team is committed to pursuing innovation and improvements through increased use of data. United by our passion for technology, curiosity about user experience, and dedication to excellence, we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.In this role, you will:Provide senior-level contribution to a team that is responsible for the design, deployment, and maintenance of the business's data platforms.Implement strategies directed at acquiring data and promoting the development of new insights across the business.Monitor existing metrics, analyze data, and lead partnerships with other Data and Analytics teams to identify and implement system and process improvements.Design, architect, implement, and support key datasets that avail structured and timely access to actionable business insights.This position can be located in either Espoo, Oslo, Kristiansand, Solna or Gothenburg. At Fortum, we apply a hybrid working model. Read more about other job opportunities, our projects and what we offer here!To excel in this role, you are expected to be:A master's or bachelor's degree holder in computer science.Experienced with more than 5 years of relevant experience in IT and business/industry.Experienced in leading Data Engineer work.Knowledgeable about Data platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and their main tools (DataBricks, Data Lake, DataFactory, Delta Lake).Knowledgeable about databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle).Knowledgeable about SW version control tools.Experienced with ETL/ELT processes.We are excited to hire ian ndividual who are passionate about data engineering and eager to contribute to our innovative team. If you share our enthusiasm, we would love to hear from you!Ready to Join Us?Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 20.03.2025 at the latest. We work with an ongoing selection and the job ad might be closed before the final application date. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Antti Heimonen by phone or via email at ***. We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you!To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.We are FortumFortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Data Engineer Fi Scsom
description: Job DescriptionData EngineerWe are urgently seeking askilled Data Engineerto join an exciting project in Finland. If you have hands-on experience inbig data technologiesand meet the security and language requirements, we want to hear from you!Key Responsibilities:Design, develop, and optimize data pipelines and workflows.Work withHadoop, Spark, Spark Streaming, and Kafkafor real-time and batch data processing.UtilizePython, PL/SQL, Hive, HBase, Cassandra, and Informaticafor data transformation and management.Deploy and maintain data solutions usingAirflow, Kubernetes, and Docker.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless data integration and analytics.RequirementsRequired Skills & Experience:4+ years of hands-on experience indata engineering.Proficiency inHadoop, Spark, Kafka, Python, PL/SQL, and Informatica.Strong knowledge ofAirflow, Kubernetes, and Docker.Must havesecurity clearanceand beproficient in Finnish.BenefitsWhy Join Us?Competitive salary & benefits package.Work on cutting-edgebig data projects.Opportunity to collaborate with top industry experts.Immediate hiring!Send yourCV, availability, and expected rate ASAP!

title: Data Engineer Finance Sector Shsiq
description: HiQ:lla missiomme on yksinkertaistaa ihmisten elämää. Syvän ja monipuolisen teknologia- ja toimialaosaamisemme sekä luovan ajattelun avulla taklaamme asiakkaidemme haasteita ja luomme entistä toimivampia ratkaisuja. HiQ:lla rakennetaan aidosti arvokkaita palveluita asiakkaalle.Meillä pääset rakentamaan yhteiskunnallisesti merkittäviä palveluja, asiakkaiden tarpeet täyttäviä end-to-end -ratkaisuja, kriittisiä taustajärjestelmiä ja meidän kaikkien käyttämiä kuluttajapalveluita. Haluamme olla ylpeitä työstämme, ja pyrimmekin aina parhaimpaamme. Siitä tulee nimemmekin, HiQ, High Quality.Mitä tarkoittaa olla HiQlainen?Se on mielenkiintoisia projekteja, afterwork-kaljoja, Full Stack -Fridayta, uuden oppimista ja toinen toisemme tukemista. Työkavereita, joista tulee aitoja ystäviä. Lapset saa lähteä hakemaan kotiin etuajassa ja välillä taas puristetaan loppukiri porukalla. Haluamme olla yhteisö, jossa haluat olla vuodesta toiseen. Paikka, jossa voit kehittyä työnantajaa vaihtamatta. Jokainen meistä vaikuttaa siihen, mitä tarkoittaa olla HiQlainen.Roolisi Data EngineerinaEtsimme kokenutta Data Engineeria osaksi pitkäaikaista finanssisektorin asiakkuuttamme. Tässä projektissa rakennat päivittäin käytettäviä pankki-, vakuutus- ja rahoituspalveluita, ja näin ollen vaikutat suoraan tuhansien suomalaisten arkeen. Sinulla on ympärilläsi joukko kokeneita HiQ-kollegoita sekä asiakkaan tiimi, jossa työskennellään ketterillä menetelmillä. Me HiQ:lla arvostamme asiantuntijuuttasi ja saat projektissa toimia itseohjautuvasti ja johtaa omaa työtäsi. Projektit ovat usein pitkiä, joten vakaata ja pitkäjänteistä työtä hakevalle tämä on oiva mahdollisuus.OdotammeEtsimme tiimiimme kokenutta Data Engineeria, jolla on useamman vuoden (+5) kokemus vaativista kehitysprojekteista ja osaamista asiakkaamme tech-stackin parissa. Tech-stack pitää sisällään muun muassa:Pilvipalvelut: Azure ja AWSBackend: Python, SQL, SparkDB2 ja PostgreSQLKokemus SASin kanssa työskentelystä on eduksi tässä työssäOdotamme myös:Osaamista pilvipalveluista, niiden käyttöönotosta ja hallinnastaKokemusta data-tuotteista ja data mesh -ratkaisuistaKykyä työskennellä liiketoimintatiimien kanssa ja auttaa heitä rakentamaan ja ylläpitämään tietokantapohjaisia ratkaisujaKykyä suunnitella ja rakentaa tehokkaita ETL-prosesseja data kerryttämiseksi ja jalostamiseksi raportointia vartenTyönteko onnistuu pääosin etänä, mutta asiakasprojektit vaativat keskimäärin 1-2 päivää viikossa läsnäoloa pääkaupunkiseudulla.Asiakkuudessa vaaditaan sujuvaa suomen- ja englanninkielen taitoa. Näemme etuna myös aiemman kokemuksen finanssialalta. Työskentely finanssialan asiakkuudessa vaatii turvallisuusselvityksen sekä mm. luottotietojen tarkistuksen.Kiinnostuitko tehtävästä ja haluaisit kuulla roolista lisää? Positiosta voit kysyä lisää Roosa-Maria Ahoselta (***) tai hae paikkaa suoraan linkin kautta.

title: Senior Data Engineer Sfsut
description: Join us!If you're ready to start the next chapter in your career journey, you've come to the right place. We're always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Read more about the role and apply.As a Senior Data Engineer you get a deep-dive into clients' data!We hope you are ready to get your hands dirty with designing, building, automating and operating data platforms and data pipelines. It's all about putting your mind into automating infrastructure, monitoring and recovery routines. Overall, the key is being curious, solving problems and recognising how to interact with different types of data and people. All the work we do is about helping and guiding our clients, so having a true consultant mindset and interest in supporting sales is what we value dearly.In our work as consultants we give high fives to agile ways of working and the importance of transparency and trust in teamwork. As a Senior Data Engineer you have talented professionals around you such as data scientists, software developers, designers and of course our clients and their end-users. You will work with a variety of projects, domains and business cases; Lately, we have been working with data architecture of a media company, building a real-time chat spam detector for a gaming company, and making data more accessible to a governmental organization.We are excited to find a talented Senior Data Engineer who is already based in the Helsinki or Tampere area and eager to collaborate with our team and customers. We offer a hybrid working mode that allows for flexibility, but it is important that the candidate is located close by one of our Finland offices to ensure seamless collaboration. Please kindly note that, at this time, we are unable to offer relocation opportunities, or we will need to be highly selective in considering such requests.Here are some practical things we'd love to see in your back pocketSeveral years of work experience in data engineeringExperience on data stack on AWS (e.g. RedShift, Glue, Athena) or on Azure (e.g. Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks)Strong know-how on building, deploying and orchestrating data infrastructure (e.g. serverless computation, Sagemaker, CI tools, Terraform, or similar tools). You have a dev-ops oriented mindset.An excellent understanding of databases. Relational databases are most often used, but many projects also employ document databases, key-value stores, and related technologies.Practical software experience from a variety of projects. Python or Java experience is on top of our list right now, but other languages are definitely considered as a plus too!Appreciation for a good communication with both the team and the clients. You are fluent in Finnish and English.CompensationYour complete compensation package will be discussed in detail during the recruitment process. Our salary model is designed to offer a range of levels based on three factors: skills, responsibilities and impact. We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and supportive work environment where every employee has the opportunity to thrive and advance in their career and become better versions of themselves.During the initial interview round, we will discuss the salary range for this position. We offer a fixed salary with the possibility of performance-based bonuses and additional benefits.Next stepsIf this sounds like the opportunity you've been looking for and are ready to take the next step, please submit your application.Our application form is about as easy as it gets. All you need to do is enter your contact information and upload your attachments. We'd love to see a CV, and a few lines about yourself and why you want to join Futurice. If you need some inspiration, read ourtipson how to stand out from the other applicants. You can also submit links to your LinkedIn and/or GitHub profile or your portfolio, as well as share other attachments relevant to the application.After we receive your application, we will reach out to you. Those selected for the interview phase can look forward to an initial discussion that will help us get to know you better, and you to get more info about life at Futurice. This is followed by an in-depth talk with your potential future colleagues to dive deeper into your professional skills. Finally, there's a general chat to discuss things like your potential future projects. It is also worth mentioning that reference calls are an integral part of our recruitment process.Working at FuturiceEver since Futurice was founded, we've been committed to offering a workplace people will genuinely enjoy coming to every morning, Mondays included. We've put tons of effort into fostering a healthy and welcoming company culture combined with fair and competitive salaries as well as perks that improve the wellbeing of each Futuricean -take a look here, check our Culture Handbook 2.0 and learn more about some of ourpeople through their career stories. Each of our offices also adds its own unique vibe and flavor into the mix. Learn more about our officeshere!At Futurice,new joinersare not expected to fit into a specific mold - people are free to come as they are, regardless of their background. We believe there's power in perspectives and consider diversity an important part of our success. You can learn more about ourDE&I commitment and efforts here.We're FuturiceWe are Futurice, an outcome-focused digital transformation company.We help our clients solve their biggest challenges and empower them to make a positive impact on the world.Founded in 2000, our team comprises over 800 diverse experts who represent more than 60 different nationalities. We have Nordic roots and a global mindset and operate across Europe.

title: Senior Data Engineer Sfsut
description: Join us!If you're ready to start the next chapter in your career journey, you've come to the right place. We're always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Read more about the role and apply.As a Senior Data Engineer you get a deep-dive into clients' data!We hope you are ready to get your hands dirty with designing, building, automating and operating data platforms and data pipelines. It's all about putting your mind into automating infrastructure, monitoring and recovery routines. Overall, the key is being curious, solving problems and recognising how to interact with different types of data and people. All the work we do is about helping and guiding our clients, so having a true consultant mindset and interest in supporting sales is what we value dearly.In our work as consultants we give high fives to agile ways of working and the importance of transparency and trust in teamwork. As a Senior Data Engineer you have talented professionals around you such as data scientists, software developers, designers and of course our clients and their end-users. You will work with a variety of projects, domains and business cases; Lately, we have been working with data architecture of a media company, building a real-time chat spam detector for a gaming company, and making data more accessible to a governmental organization.We are excited to find a talented Senior Data Engineer who is already based in the Helsinki or Tampere area and eager to collaborate with our team and customers. We offer a hybrid working mode that allows for flexibility, but it is important that the candidate is located close by one of our Finland offices to ensure seamless collaboration. Please kindly note that, at this time, we are unable to offer relocation opportunities, or we will need to be highly selective in considering such requests.Here are some practical things we'd love to see in your back pocketSeveral years of work experience in data engineeringExperience on data stack on AWS (e.g. RedShift, Glue, Athena) or on Azure (e.g. Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks)Strong know-how on building, deploying and orchestrating data infrastructure (e.g. serverless computation, Sagemaker, CI tools, Terraform, or similar tools). You have a dev-ops oriented mindset.An excellent understanding of databases. Relational databases are most often used, but many projects also employ document databases, key-value stores, and related technologies.Practical software experience from a variety of projects. Python or Java experience is on top of our list right now, but other languages are definitely considered as a plus too!Appreciation for a good communication with both the team and the clients. You are fluent in Finnish and English.CompensationYour complete compensation package will be discussed in detail during the recruitment process. Our salary model is designed to offer a range of levels based on three factors: skills, responsibilities and impact. We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and supportive work environment where every employee has the opportunity to thrive and advance in their career and become better versions of themselves.During the initial interview round, we will discuss the salary range for this position. We offer a fixed salary with the possibility of performance-based bonuses and additional benefits.Next stepsIf this sounds like the opportunity you've been looking for and are ready to take the next step, please submit your application.Our application form is about as easy as it gets, just enter your contact information and upload your attachments. We're hoping to see at least your CV and a few lines about yourself and why you want to join Futurice (for inspiration, take a lookhereto read our tips on how to stand out from the other applicants). You'll also have the option to submit links to your LinkedIn and/or GitHub profile or your portfolio, as well as share other attachments relevant to the application.We will process the applications in the order of their arrival. Those selected for the interview phase can look forward to an initial discussion, both in order for us to get to know you better, and for you to get more familiar with life at Futurice. That will be followed by an in-depth talk with your potential future colleagues to dive deeper into your professional skills, and finally, one more general chat where you'll discuss things like your potential future projects. It is also worth mentioning that reference calls are an integral part of our recruitment process.How we workEver since Futurice was founded, we've been committed to offering a workplace people will genuinely enjoy coming to every morning, Mondays included. We've put tons of effort into fostering a healthy and welcoming company culture combined with fair and competitive salaries as well as perks that improve the wellbeing of each Futuricean -take a look here, check our Culture Handbook 2.0 and learn more about some of ourpeople through their career stories. Each of our offices also adds its own unique vibe and flavor into the mix. Learn more about our officeshere!At Futurice,new joinersare not expected to fit into a specific mold - people are free to come as they are, regardless of their background. We believe there's power in perspectives and consider diversity an important part of our success. You can learn more about ourDE&I commitment and efforts here.We're FuturiceWe are Futurice, an outcome-focused digital transformation company.We help our clients solve their biggest challenges and empower them to make a positive impact on the world.Founded in 2000, our team comprises over 800 diverse experts who represent more than 60 different nationalities. We have Nordic roots and a global mindset and operate across Europe.

title: Data Engineer Analytics Hay Day Sssup
description: Helsinki - onsite - full-time, permanentData Engineer (Analytics), Hay DayYou know the feeling when you've beaten your personal high score? Working in Analytics at Supercell is like having those moments everyday. And better yet, making the best gameplay decision is a perfect blend of intuition and data.As a Data Engineer in Hay Day, you will own the data landscape for the team, from defining what to collect, how to ensure the quality of it, and how to build the data products that deliver the best results to your fellow team members, including analysts, game designers, QA, live operations managers and anyone who wants to augment their intuition with hard facts.We are working towards being hypothesis driven and for that - we need your skills to help us build our data and tooling to be ready to continuously improve our service. Picture yourself leveling up our tooling to legendary status of the highest of echelons. Rock solid and modern, others would say. Continuously raising the bar is your choice of approach.You won't be playing a follow-the-script type of a game with us. You are the forward-thinking, data-loving problem solver type who is seasoned to spot opportunities even when they're in stealth mode.You'll be joining a company where thoughtfulness, quality and focus are kept in high regard. We are passionate about not compromising on quality and choosing a long term approach to make Supercell a truly global games company that will last for many decades to come.Time to send us your application?ResponsibilitiesOwner of Hay Day specific data pipelines and data products.Plan, execute and maintain the roadmaps for data engineering improvement in your team, as well as integrating company wide data engineering initiatives.Define what data is collected to best serve our business needs.Design and implement the server-side tracking events for new and existing features.Build data pipelines to deliver new datasets and discover new insights.Proactively suggest and implement improvements that increase scalability, robustness and availability of data systems.Together with the analytics engineering team, contribute to developing the company wide vision and strategy for data engineering practices.Requirements+5 years of experience in data engineering or another relevant domainExpert knowledge of Python and SQLHighly proactive and independent doerStrong communication skillsTrack record of maintaining large scale ETL processesExperience with modern data stackFamiliarity with large scale data warehouse technologies (e.g. Databricks, Spark)Familiarity of build, deployment and orchestration toolsPassion for pumping out the highest quality data in a fast-paced environmentBenefits and CompensationLuring you in with glitter, glamour, and gems is not what we seek to do. We develop Supercell as an employer for you to do your best work and to call this the best experience in your professional life.We want you to enjoy your time here fully, so we structure our compensation and benefits to serve this purpose. It starts with perceiving you as a human being, not a resource.Read MoreAbout SupercellWe are a game company based in Helsinki, Finland, with offices in San Francisco, Seoul and Shanghai. Since our launch in 2010, we've released six games globally - Hay Day, Clash of Clans, Boom Beach, Clash Royale, Brawl Stars, and Squad Busters .To make six games, we've killed dozens along the way. That's because we're obsessed with quality.Our mission is to create great games that as many people as possible play for years and that are remembered forever. To achieve this goal, we put together the best possible teams and give them the freedom and independence to succeed.Read MoreYou Might Love It Here...If you love games, Supercell is the place for you. We're made up of proactive, independent teams that have the freedom to do what they think is best for their players, our games, and the company.We know it takes more than trust and independence to make great games, so we also take good care of our people, providing them with the compensation, work environment and resources they need to succeed and have fun while at it.Read MoreYou Are Not Your Job TitleWorking with us means you won't need to focus on chasing titles or climbing ladders. We've decided that our internal job titles don't include prefixes like senior, junior, principal, or director. Instead, we embrace our non-hierarchical culture, allowing us to concentrate on what truly matters: doing what's best for our players. Recognition isn't tied to your job title, nor does your title define the impact you can have.For hiring purposes, we do use industry-standard job titles to help attract talent. When it comes to public-facing spaces like LinkedIn, we trust and encourage everyone to select a title that feels most appropriate for them.Read MoreThis position is in Helsinki, but you're not?Luckily, moving to Helsinki is easier than you might think. No matter where you would be moving from, our dedicated people will help you from beginning to end. We're here to ensure the process is as smooth as possible for you, your family and whoever and whatever you bring along. In addition to cats and dogs, we've even relocated a horse.Read MoreNot sure if you should apply?Do it! You might feel like you don't tick all the listed requirements with stellar scores. That's fine! We're here to help you succeed. Also, we're happy to learn about any specific accommodations you might require to fully engage in our recruitment process.And here's a video about what we do. (Best enjoyed with salmiakki and rye bread)

title: Summer Trainee Data Engineer Helsinki Sfsut
description: Join us!What if summer 2025 made all the difference in kick-starting your future career journey as a Data Engineer? Now is your chance to spend the summer doing what you would love doing the most professionally: building digital products at one of Finland's leading digital engineering and innovation companies.We're always happy to hear from curious, motivated people who are eager to learn, grow, and share our values. Read more about the role and apply by Wednesday, March 26th, 2025!About the roleYour summer will consist of project work either in one of our external client projects or in an internal development project - or perhaps a bit of both. Location can be either Tampere or Helsinki and you get to work full-time. You will be working alongside an experienced cross-disciplinary team to learn the craft of modern data consulting.On top of learning and interesting projects, you get to network with our active international Slack community, you get to participate in Futurice events, and enjoy a wide list of Futurice provided benefits. If you're up for it, there might be a possibility to continue your Futurice journey after summer.What you'll be doing:Assisting in the development and maintenance of data pipelines and ETL processesWorking with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP to store and process dataCollaborating with software developers, data scientists, and business stakeholdersGaining experience in databases (SQL & NoSQL) and data modelingLearning and working with tools like Python, Spark, Airflow, or similar technologiesSupporting the team in ensuring data quality, monitoring, and troubleshooting issuesWhat we're looking for:A curious mind eager to learn about data engineering and cloud technologiesSome experience with Python, SQL, or other relevant programming languagesBasic understanding of using & developing in cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure or GCP and ideally some experience from one of the mentioned platforms.Strong problem-solving skills and a hands-on approach to challengesA team player who enjoys collaboration and knowledge-sharingFluency in Finnish and English.Wise words from our previous Summer TraineeSo that you would get an even better picture of how the summer at Futurice would look like we asked our 2024 Summer Trainee James to share his experience with you."My experience as a data engineer trainee at Futurice has to be the highlight of my summer. I got the opportunity to explore various technologies and collaborate with senior data professionals in delivering top-notch data solutions. The interactions with clients and fellow colleagues also helped me develop soft skills such as communication and interpersonal relationships. Every day at Futurice is a learning opportunity, and I get to do that with amazing colleagues." -James Afolaranmi, Data EngineerDon't worry, we don't expect you to know everything beforehand. The main expectation for you is to be willing and able to learn a lot.Here are three tips that our last year Summer Trainees wanted to give for 2025 Summer Trainee applicants:1️⃣ Always apply! Even if you don't get hired, the application process is a valuable learning experience.2️⃣ Showcase your projects, no matter how simple they are.3️⃣ Don't get discouraged. Landing a job can be tough, especially if it's your first one.Next steps📅 Apply by Wednesday, March 26th, 2025!Send us your CV, cover letter, and a showcase of your most awesome study/hobby projects. We review applications on a rolling basis, so don't wait until the deadline!Tell us:✨ Who you are and why Futurice is the right place for you✨ How you see yourself growing into the Data Engineer role✨ If applicable, mention your student organization or guild background-we appreciate community-minded people!✨ (Optional) Include a transcript of your studies if you feel it adds relevant information about your skills.💡 Need inspiration? We've created an article about how to write great job applications-check it out!CompensationOur salary model is based on skills, responsibilities, and impact, aligning with your seniority and accountability. To promote inclusiveness, we follow an open salary policy. Monthly compensation to this position is between 2730-3190€ with possible bonuses and additional benefits.FAQ - Your questions aswered❓ Can I work part-time, or is this only a full-time position?🔹 The Summer Trainee position is full-time to ensure a valuable learning experience.❓ What happens after the Summer Trainee period?🔹 There may be opportunities to continue part-time after summer.❓ When does the Summer Trainee period start and end?🔹 The Summer Trainee period runs from May to August (5.5.-31.8.2025). Start and end dates may be flexible depending on individual needs.❓ Is remote work possible?🔹 Office location is in Tampere or Helsinki. We have a hybrid working mode depending on the team, so occasional work from home might be possible. We don't offer relocation or remote work opportunities outside Finland.❓ Is there an age limit for Summer Trainee positions?🔹 No! As long as you are of legal age, anyone is welcome to apply.❓ Do I need to submit a transcript of my studies?🔹 It's not mandatory. If you feel it adds relevant information about your skills, you can include it. However, the minimum required application documents are CV, cover letter, and a study/hobby project showcase.🚀Excited to start your journey as an Data Engineer Trainee at Futurice? Apply now!We're FuturiceWe are Futurice, an outcome-focused digital transformation company.We help our clients solve their biggest challenges and empower them to make a positive impact on the world.Founded in 2000, our team comprises over 800 diverse experts who represent more than 60 different nationalities. We have Nordic roots and a global mindset and operate across Europe.

title: Senior Aws Data Engineer Innovation Center Of Excellence Scsgi
description: Position Description:CGI on yksi suurimmista IT- ja liiketoimintakonsultoinnin yrityksistä Suomessa ja maailmalla. Vahva kokemuksemme eri toimialoilta auttaa julkisen ja yksityisen sektorin asiakkaitamme onnistumaan digitaalisessa muutoksessa ja saavuttamaan tavoitteitaan entistä tehokkaammin.Senior AWS Data Engineer, Innovation Center of ExcellenceCGI Suomen innovaatiokeskus ICE (Innovation Center of Excellence) kehittää ja toimittaa pilviteknologioihin, analytiikkaan, tekoälyyn, automaatioon ja designiin perustuvia uusia palveluja ja ratkaisuja CGI:n asiakkaille Suomessa ja kansainvälisesti. Innovaatiokeskuksen alla toimiva Advanced Analytics Solutions -yksikkö etsii nyt Senior AWS Data Engineeriä.Tässä tehtävässä olet mukana suunnittelemassa ja toteuttamassa moderneja pilvipohjaisia data-alustoja ja tietovarastoja AWS:ään. Työsi voi sisältää muun muassa lähes reaaliaikaisten integraatioiden rakentamista, tietovirtojen optimointia sekä asiakkaiden tukemista arkkitehtuurivalinnoissa.Tässä roolissa pääset osallistumaan myyntiprojekteihin. Työlläsi autat asiakkaitamme kehittämään liiketoimintaansa datan avulla.Tuleva tiimisiAdvanced Analytics Solutions -yksikkö on keskittynyt data-analytiikan hyödyntämiseen liiketoiminnan kehittämisessä ja sen palveluvalikoimaan sisältyvät erilaiset datan hallintaan, data-arkkitehtuuriin ja datastrategiaan liittyvät neuvonantopalvelut sekä kattavat analytiikkasovellusten, data-alustojen ja koneoppimisratkaisujen toteutuspalvelut. Lisäksi tarjoamme tukea, ylläpitoa ja jatkuvaa pienkehitystä edellä mainituille ratkaisuille.Työskentelemme kaikkien yleisimpien pilvialustojen kanssa (Azure, AWS, GCP) ja meillä on vahvaa osaamista johtavista BI-teknologioista (Power BI, Tableau).Kaiken tekemisemme taustalla on yhteen hiileen puhaltava tiimimme, jossa jokaisen asiantuntijuudella on oma paikkansa. Tehtävässäsi pääset nauttimaan samanhenkisten tiimikaveriesi seurasta ja tueksesi saat kehitystäsi valmentavan esihenkilön. Kanssamme viihdyt varmasti!Tämän tehtävän sijaintipaikka on Helsinki, mutta toimimme CGI:llä joustavasti hybridimallilla, yhdistäen etä- ja lähityöskentelyä.Edellytämme sinulta• kokemusta datainsinöörinä toimimisesta, etenkin AWS-ympäristöissä• vahvaa osaamista tietovarastoratkaisuista, kuten Snowflake, ja ETL/ELT-työkaluista, kuten Matillion tai Glue• hyviä ohjelmointitaitoja, etenkin Python ja SQL• kokemusta asiakasrajapinnassa toimisesta• sujuvaa suomen ja englannin kielen taitoa• lisäksi arvostamme kokemusta data-arkkitehtuurien suunnittelusta ja kokemusta myynnin tukena toimisesta, kuten teknisten tarjousten laatimisesta tai esitysten pitämisestäTarjoamme sinulleTiedämme, että onnistuminen perustuu ihmisiin ja kulttuuriin, toimivia työkaluja ja teknologiaa unohtamatta. CGI:llä saat luoda juuri sinulle sopivaa urapolkua mielenkiintoisten tehtävien sekä sisäisen urakierron kautta. Voit myös jatkuvasti kehittää taitojasi ja syventää osaamistasi mm. CGI Academian avulla.Tarjoamme sinulle työn, jossa voit kehittyä haluamaasi suuntaan sekä mahdollisuuden omistaa yhtiön osakkeita ainutlaatuisen osakesäästöohjelmamme avulla. Henkilöstöstämme 85 % on osakkeenomistajia ja siksi olemmekin CGI Partnereita.Meillä työ joustaa, kun elämäntilanteesi sitä vaatii. Pidämme huolta sinusta ja hyvinvoinnistasi monipuolisin henkilöstöeduin ja tarjoamme mm. kattavan työterveyshuollon, vapaa-ajan vakuutuksen, sairaan lapsen hoitopalvelun sekä mahdollisuuden työsuhdepolkupyörään. Osallistumalla CGI:n hyvinvointiyhteisöjen toimintaan pääset myös tutustumaan työkavereihin eri puolilta taloa yhteisten harrastusten parissa.Tutustu meihin lisää yrityskohtaisesta työehtosopimuksestamme!Tule rakentamaan omaa urapolkuasi meille!Mikäli tämä tehtävä voisi olla seuraava askel urallasi, haethan tehtävää 31.3.2025 mennessä. Etenemme rekrytointiprosessissa heti sopivan kandidaatin löydyttyä. Lisätietoja tehtävästä antaa Matti Suikkari, numerosta ******.Perusmuotoinen turvallisuusselvitys tullaan tekemään tehtävän niin vaatiessa.Tutustu meihin lisää:CGI UraFacebook ,Instagram ,LinkedIn ,X ,YouTube#LI-FPBSkills:Data WarehousingEnglishETLSQLData ArchitectureFinnishSnowflakeWhat you can expect from us:Together, as owners, let's turn meaningful insights into action.Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you'll reach your full potential because...You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That's why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company's strategy and direction.Your work creates value. You'll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.You'll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You'll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.Come join our team-one of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

title: Senior Data Engineer In House Snsig
description: Senior Data Engineer - Real-time Streaming FocusAre you a talented Data Engineer with 3+ years of experience, looking for a new challenge in a highly impactful, data-driven role? If you're ready to join a forward-thinking company and have a strong background in real-time streaming, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.Key Requirements:* 3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer (preferably at a senior level or with the ability to work independently)* Hands-on experience with real-time streaming technologies (Python, Azure Databricks, Azure Event Hub, Azure IoT Hub, Kafka, AWS)* Strong fluency in Finnish* Experience in gaming industries is a plus, as this role has a strong focus on real-time data streamingThe Role: Join a dynamic and innovative AI & Data Streams unit within the energy sector, where you'll contribute to cutting-edge digital solutions that optimize energy systems and enhance customer experiences. As a Senior Data Engineer, you'll be responsible for:* Developing and integrating data platforms and systems, particularly in the industrial automation, process, and production domains* Building, testing, and monitoring efficient data pipelines* Implementing robust data quality methods* Designing and maintaining data models and architecture* Managing the full data lifecycleThe team uses an Azure cloud environment, with tools like Azure Databricks, Synapse, Data Explorer, and EventHub.Why This Role?* Impactful Work in the energy sector* Advanced and Modern Tech Stack* Fun and Flexible Company Culture:If you're passionate about leveraging data to drive positive change and want to be part of a company that truly values its data professionals, this is your chance to make a meaningful impact. Apply today!

title: Senior Data Engineer Partner Tech Scsom
description: Zalando Partner Tech is the technology organisation within Zalando responsible for sourcing fashion products and consumer goods into Zalando. Through our platform and tools, we provide a wide range of products to customers all over Europe. The organisation is composed of more than 300 talented individuals who are dedicated to creating the best platform and inspiring opportunities for multi million euro fashion brands and physical retail stores, connecting them with consumers across multiple European markets.As a(Senior) Data Engineerwithin Partner Tech, you will get the opportunity to build a new data platform from the early stages together with your team. You will work in a welcoming and inclusive team of data engineers and software engineers. You will be responsible for the collection, transformation, and visualisation of data, consumed by Zalando Partners and internal users. You will communicate frequently with your team's stakeholders to understand and react to their needs in order to raise the data capabilities of all of Partner Tech.INCLUSIVE BY DESIGNAt Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy: https://corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategyOur employee resource groups: https://corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groupsWHAT WE'D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)Be in the driver's seat. You enjoy being proactive, addressing intricate business problems and taking the initiative to independently explore and understand them.Proactively look for ways to enhance existing tooling and processes.You will support the implementation of a reliable and performant data infrastructure that integrates with internal and 3rd party tools.Collaborate with diverse teams of talented data analysts, applied scientists, business analysts, product managers, and software engineers to implement and maintain high-performance data-processing and data integration systems on top of lake house architecture.Work with other data engineers, and peers in central data platform teams to develop the system architecture and ensure seamless integration into Zalando's central data platform.Establish and enforce data quality standards throughout the ETL process.Set up mechanisms to proactively identify and address potential issues before they impact data integrity.WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF YOU HAVESeveral years of experience in engineering best practices, designing, implementing scalable data pipelines from data lake.Strong experience of running data processing pipelines using distributed data processing frameworks like Apache Spark. Databricks experience is a must.Experience in working with MPP data warehouse, e.g. Redshift, Big Query, Snowflake.You have solid programming skills in Python.Hands-on experience with a cloud ecosystem (AWS, GCP) and integration with orchestration services (Airflow).You have excellent verbal and written communication skills in English with an ability to articulate complex technical topics and solutions concisely and simply.Nice to have: Experience to technically guide and lead data engineers and analysts.If you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every requirement. You may be the right candidate for this or other roles!OUR OFFERCentrally located and accessible office in Kamppi, Helsinki city center, with diverse working and entertainment spaces and healthy snacks and drinks available.Hybrid work model of up to 60% remote work and flexible working times.40% Zalando shopping discount for employees, employee share shop, bike benefit, and Edenred benefits for lunch, sports and culture, commuting and massage.Extensive occupational health care and child care benefits.Additional holidays and volunteering time off.Supportive and active international community of colleagues for onboarding, mentoring, continued learning and for having fun through diverse offering of meetups and events, knowledge guilds and Employee Resource Groups with open source commitment.Relocation assistance for internationals.Learn all about Zalando and our values here: https://jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us. For more information about our office and teams in Helsinki, please visit: https://jobs.zalando.com/en/where-we-work/helsinkiPlease note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

title: Open Application Data Engineer Tietoevry Tech Services Stsie
description: You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.Tietoevry Tech Services is seeking a highly skilled and dynamicData Engineerto join our Data & AI team. You can be a Data Engineer with few years of work experience or a more seasoned professional with long history in data domain. As a Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining data solutions that enable our clients to make informed business decisions.We at Tietoevry Tech Services design, build and operate modern cloud-based data management solutions for our valued customers - from source data to data driven tools & applications.We work with modern data related technologies in cloud space including such as Azure, AWS, Snowflake, Databricks, Spark and MS Fabric. We are valuable partners with Microsoft and other major BI vendors giving us a great opportunity to learn, grow and apply those technologies in our customer deliveries. We are taking care about data solutions for biggest Nordic companies to help them better understand their customer needs and improve their business.In this role you will:Design, build, and optimize high-volume batch and real-time data pipelinesDevelop and maintain data lake infrastructure, data warehousing, data platforms and data analytic toolsCollaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and ensure data accuracy and integrityImplement data quality, governance and security measures.Provide data insights and support to business intelligence (BI) teamsDevelop data visualizations to help our customers get the most out of their dataFor a more senior data engineer, in addition to your long and proven track record as data engineer, we look for a person who is able to share knowledge and help more junior colleagues in their professional growth or support our account teams and their customers in data business development.Skills and experience we are looking for our new colleague:Work experience in data engineer role: +3 yearsFluency in both Finnish and English, with excellent written and verbal communication skillsExperience working in modern cloud environments, such as AWS, Azure, or GCPSolid understanding of data lake infrastructure, data modelling, data warehousing, databases (SQL/NoSQL) and ETL/ELTSolid programming skills (for example Python, R or Java)Proven hands-on experience in building high-volume batch and real-time data pipelinesHands on experience with modern data platforms, such as MS Fabric, Databricks or SnowflakeStrong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work as part of team in customer interface or individually as subject matter expertExperience in data analytics and data visualization tools is highly valuableInterest for self-development, keeping up with new possibilities and technologies available to help our customers to reach their data goals and beyond. For example, utilizing AI based new and emerging solutionsLocation:This position is based in Finland, with most customers operating typically from the capital areaEmployment Type:Full-timeWhat's in it for you?We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects with the latest technologies, open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We offer you an opportunity to create the future of a growing and fast developing and important sector. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also strongly believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new opportunities emerge.Join us and make your mark!We look forward to your application! Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we'll reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Juha Anttila via e-mail *** to hear from you soon!#LI-HybridAt Tietoevry , we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation.Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity andinclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Data Engineer Business Intelligence Pinja Group Oy Jyvaskyla Stsyo
description: Data Engineer - Hae mukaan tiedolla johtamisen hankkeisiimme!Etsimme tiedolla johtamisen hankkeisiimme tietovarastojen parissa työskentelevää Data Engineeriä tai Senior Data EngineeriäData Engineerinä työnäsi on rakentaa tiimisi kanssa toimivia ja laadukkaita tietovarastoja. Vastaat ETL prosessin rakentamisesta, tiedon mallintamisesta ja kuljettamisesta raportointikerrokseen raportointityövälineiden saataville. Muotoilemme mielellämme työkuvaasi vastaamaan osaamistasi ja toiveitasi. Voit työssäsi painottua esimerkiksi enemmän mallinnukseen, automaatioon, tai vaikkapa tiedon integrointiin. Kerro meille toiveesi!Yhteisenä teknisenä nimittäjänä meillä on Microsoftin tuotteet: Azuren eri datavälineet (Fabric, Data Factory, Synapse, Data Lake jne) sekä MS SQL Server tuotteet (esim SSIS). Raportointikerroksessa käytämme Power BI:tä. Panostamme vahvasti Microsoft Fabricin käyttöön ja opiskeluun ja hankkeemme toteutetaankin yleensä Fabricilla!Tulevaisuudessa siintää jatkuvasti uusia mielenkiintoisia ratkaisuvaihtoehtoja sekä tekniikoita, joita olemme innostuneet kokeilemaan ensimmäisten joukossa. Koulutuslupauksemme turvin sinullakin on mahdollisuus päästä oppimaan uusia tekniikoita ja kehittämään osaamistasi ammattilaisena.Työtä tehdään meillä pienissä tiimeissä ja tiimimme on pyritty muodostamaan siten, että ne kykenevät tuottamaan itsenäisesti valmiita lopputuloksia. Tyypillisesti tiimissämme on BI- ja tietovarastoasiantuntijoita eri osaamispainotuksin, arkkitehti sekä projektipäällikkö.Toimimme useilla toimialoilla (teollisuus, yksityinen sektori sekä julkiset toimijat), joten saat vaihtelua työtehtäviisi tietosisältöjen ja käytettävien tekniikoiden osalta. Toisaalta monipuolinen toimialaosaamisemme luo turvallista jatkuvuutta.Voit työskennellä viihtyisillä toimistoillamme esimerkiksi Espoossa, Tampereella, Seinäjoella, Vaasassa, Kempeleessä, Kuopiossa ja Jyväskylässä tai täysin etänä!Mitä tehtävässä onnistumiseen vaaditaan?Olet aiemmin työskennellyt esimerkiksi Azure tai Microsoft SQL server pohjaisten ratkaisujen parissa. Ymmärrät ETL työn periaatteet ja tiedon mallinnus on lähellä sydäntäsi. Tiimityössä tuot mielipiteesi rohkeasti ja rakentavasti esille perusteineen. Jos kaveri on pulassa tarjoat apuasi. Kun itse tarvitset apua, on sitä myös meidän kulttuurissamme aina tarjolla!Mitä taitoja sinulta odotamme:Kokemusta tiedolla johtamisen hankkeista teknisessä roolissa.Relevanttia Data Engineerin / tietovarastokehittäjän työkokemusta +2 vuotta.Hyvät sosiaaliset taidot kohdata tiimiäsi ja myös välillä asiakkaitamme.Järjestelmällisyyttä ja kykyä johtaa itseäsi sovitussa aikataulussa.Microsoft Power BI osaamista.Hyvää SQL osaamista.Ymmärrystä tiedon mallintamisesta.Teknistä osaamista ja näkemystä yhdestä tai useammasta seuraavasta:Microsoft FabricAzure Data FactorySQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)Hyvää suomen kielen taitoa.Lisäksi eduksesi luetaan:Erilaiset tekniset sertifikaatit.Python osaaminen.Databricks osaaminen.Data Lake ratkaisujen parissa toimiminen.Pinjalaisena saat käyttöösi lukuisia etujaPeruspilarit kunnossa: kattava työterveyshuolto ja vakuutukset.Tuemme henkilöstön hyvinvointia: välipala-, lounas-, virike/liikunta-, työmatka-, hieronta- ja hammasetu.Panostamme henkilöstön kehittymiseen: 10 työpäivää vuodessa osaamisen kehittämiseen ja laaja koulutustarjonta Pinja Academyssä.Lisäksi etuina: Puhelinetu, pienpalkkiot ja rekrytointipalkkiot.Panostamme yhteisöllisyyteen: kuukausittaiset tapahtumat ja aamiaiset, paikkakuntakohtaisesti liikuntavuoroja ja tiimipäivät.Monipuoliset työntekomallit: työt hoituvat joustavasti 100 % etänä, hybridinä tai joltakin toimistoltamme ympäri Suomen (9 paikkakuntaa).Haluamasi työvälineet: Voit valita työvälineesi ja saat ergonomisen työskentelypisteen toimistolle tai kotiisi.Joustava arki: Joustavat työajat tukevat työn ja vapaa-ajan yhteensovittamista.Tutustu lisää Pinjan kymmeniin henkilöstöetuihin: https://blog.pinja.com/fi/pinjan-kymmenet-henkilostoedut-tukevat-hyvinvointiaPinjalaisuus pähkinänkuoressa:Keitä olemme? IT-alan huippuammattilaisia pohjoisesta, varustettuna omilla erityistaidoilla ja osaamisella. Olemme ylpeitä Pinja-perheestämme, jossa jokainen saa olla oma itsensä. Meitä on jo yli 500 data loversia, yli 30 eri kansallisuudesta.Me rakastamme dataa. Data on koodattu pinjalaisten DNA:han. Datasta saadun tiedon avulla kehitämme asiakkaidemme liiketoimintaa tulevaisuuden kestäväksi. Siksi pinjalaisia kutsutaankin nimellä #datalovers.Mitä teemme? Olemme asiakkaidemme kumppani kaikessa, mitä datalla ja digitalisaatiolla voidaan saavuttaa. Varmistamme asiakkaidemme menestyksen omilla SaaS-tuotteillamme ja palveluillamme. Missiomme on rakentaa kestävämpää maailmaa tavu tavulta.Rekrytoinnin eteneminen:Haku päättyy 30.3.2025.Käymme kaikki hakemukset läpi saapumisjärjestyksessä. Paikka täytetään heti sopivan henkilön löydyttyä.Lähetä hakemus siis pian, niin voit päästä osaksi tiimiämme ja data lovers -tarinaamme!

title: Senior Data Engineer Tietoevry Create Mfd Stsie
description: You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.Haluatko Senior Data Engineeriksi finanssialalle? Liity Tietoevry Create -tiimiin! Olemme edelläkävijä digitaalisessa kehityksessä, innovaatioissa ja kestävän arvon tuottamisessa. Tietoevry Createn Suomen yksikkö palvelee noin 130 asiakasta erilaisissa ohjelmistokehitystarpeissa. Työskentelemme monilla toimialoilla, kuten pankki-, vakuutus-, eläke- ja metsäalalla, julkishallinnossa sekä kaupan ja logistiikan alalla.Millaisia toimeksiantoja ja tehtäviä meillä on tarjolla?Haemme nyt kokenutta Data Engineeriä ensisijaisesti vakuutusalan asiakkaidemme projekteihin pääkaupunkiseudulle. Laaja asiakaskuntamme tarjoaa kuitenkin mahdollisuuden ammatilliseen kasvuun monipuolisissa tehtävissä eri toimialoilla.Tässä haussa toivomme erityisesti osaamista tietovarastoinnista, arkkitehtuurista ja datan mallinnuksesta. Tuotat liiketoiminnalle ratkaisuja itsenäisesti, yhdessä Data & Analytics (D&A)- ja liiketoimintatiimien kanssa. Omaksut dataa ja liiketoimintaa nopeasti, mutta apua ja perehdytystä löytyy toki data-alustatiimistä. Hallitset riippuvuuksia ja kokonaisuuden eheyttä. Vastaat laadullisten vaatimusten toteutumisesta, arvioit vaatimusten vaikutusta arkkitehtuuriin sekä neuvottelet tarvittaessa sidosryhmien kanssa. Lisäksi edellytämme, että sinulla on valmius työskennellä sekä suomen että englannin kielellä.Tulet menestymään tehtävässä, mikäli sinulla on seuraavaa kokemusta:Data Vault ja dimensionaalinen mallinnus.ETL kehittäminen.AWS:n peruspalvelut.Datatoimeksiantojen määrittely.Vakuutusliiketoiminta.Menestystäsi tehtävässä edistävät myös:Into ja taito edistää datalähtöistä liiketoimintaaKokemus tietovarastoinnissa käytettävistä Snowflakesta ja MatillionistaAjan tasalla pysyminen AI-trendeistä ja -teknologioistaHalu kehittää omaa ja muun tiimin toimintaaProaktiivinen ajattelutapa ja positiivinen asenneVahvat ongelmanratkaisutaidot ja tarkkuusKyky työskennellä itsenäisesti ja osana tiimiä.Mitä tarjoamme sinulle?Mahtavat ja asiantuntevat työkaverit Suomessa ja maailmalla.Mahdollisuuden työskennellä kokeneiden testauksen asiantuntijoiden kanssa.Mahdollisuuden kasvaa projekteissa uusiin tehtäviin ja rooleihin isossa organisaatiossamme.Mahdollisuuden työskennellä yhteiskunnan ja liike-elämän eri sektoreilla.Monipuoliset mahdollisuudet osallistua oppimisyhteisöihin (esim. Quality Engineering -yhteisö).Mahdollisuudet sertifikaatteihin ja verkko-oppimisalustan käyttöön.Kattavat työsuhde-edut, kuten ePassin lounas-, hyvinvointi-, kulttuuri- ja työmatkaedun, kattavat työterveyspalvelut, sekä m ahdollisuuden leasing-pyörään ja -autoon.Mahdollisuuden käyttää yrityksen mökkejä Saariselällä ja Vierumäellä.Hybridityön ja joustavat työajat.Innostuitko?Kuulemme mielellämme sinusta lisää ja odotamme innolla hakemustasi9.3.2025mennessä! Voit myös lisätietojen osalta olla meihin yhteydessä. Lisätietoja roolista antaa Paula Zacharov paula.zacharov@tietoevry.comTehtävään valittavalle henkilölle teetetään turvallisuusselvitys.#LI-HybridAt Tietoevry , we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation.Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity andinclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Senior Data Science And Machine Learning Engineer Snsok
description: JOB DESCRIPTIONWe are seeking an experienced Data Science/Machine Learning Engineer with a proven track record of developing and deploying ML solutions at scale. The ideal candidate combines deep statistical knowledge with strong engineering capabilities, bringing 10+ years of experience in building production-ready AI/ML systems. This role bridges the gap between cutting-edge machine learning research and practical business applications, requiring both technical excellence and business acumen.RESPONSIBILITIESDesign and develop advanced machine learning solutions, from concept to production deployment, addressing complex business challenges.Build and optimize data pipelines, features, and ML infrastructure to support
