title: Data Analyst Intern Fixed Term Stshe
description: IQM is a global leader in designing, building, and selling superconducting quantum computers. IQM provides both on-premises full-stack quantum computers and a cloud platform to access its computers anywhere in the world. IQM customers include the leading high-performance computing centres, research labs, universities and enterprises which have full access to IQM's software and hardware. IQM has over 280 employees with offices in Finland, Germany, France, Spain, Poland, Singapore and the US.(www.meetiqm.com)We are seeking a motivated Data Analyst Trainee to support our teams in quantifying goals and building visualisation dashboards to track progress. This role will be integral in developing tools to improve data-driven decision-making and exploring data to identify trends.Duration:Fixed Term, 6 monthsExpected start date:April - May2025What will I be doing?Building Tableau Dashboards to support data-driven decision makingReviewing current dashboards and collecting feedback from stakeholdersCommunicating feedback to the development team regarding data needs from other teamsHandling requests for improvements and creating bug-fixing tickets in JiraDepending on your interests and skills, contributing to ELT processes and assist in building datasets in our data warehouseWhat skills do I need?Experience in any data visualization toolsExperience in querying databasesBasic knowledge or experience in Python, Jira, and GitQuantitative educational background (Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, etc.)Good written and spoken EnglishSkills that we consider good to have but not mandatory:Knowledge in Physics and/or QuantumKnowledge in business /salesWhat can I expect from IQM?An opportunity to work with a passionate and diverse team on an important missionA unique opportunity to make a real impact on the future of quantumGrowth and progress in a creative and open start-up environmentMeet our people and hear more about IQMby visiting ourYoutube channel hereWe'll proceed with the interviews immediately, so please submit your application soon.Please note that only applications submitted through the website will be processed.Perks and benefitsThis job comes with several perks and benefitsFlexible working hoursFree coffee / teaNear public transitFree office snacksWellnessSocial gatheringsSee all 15 benefitsWorking atIQM Quantum ComputersSee company profileIQM is a Pan-European leader in quantum computers. IQM provides on-site quantum computing for research labs and supercomputing data centers and offers full access to its hardware. For industrial customers, IQM delivers the quantum advantage through a unique application-specific co-design approach. IQM is building Finland's first commercial 54-qubit quantum computer with VTT, and an IQM-led consortium (Q-Exa) is building a quantum computer in Germany that will be integrated into an HPC supercomputer to create an accelerator for future scientific research. IQM has offices in Espoo, Munich, Madrid, Paris, Singapore, and Palo Alto and employs over 250 people. More information: www.meetiqm.comRead more about IQM Quantum Computers

title: Information Architect Data Governance Scsom
description: We are looking for an Information Architect to join our Business Intelligence & Information Management team in Helsinki. You will join a growing team supporting the rapid growth of RELEX by providing data, information and insight to fuel decision making and business process improvement.As an Information Architect, you will work closely with our business stakeholders and Enterprise Architecture to ensure that information requirements are captured and modelled in alignment with the organization's goals and objectives. Your role will be integral to establishing smooth collaboration with various Information, Data and System Owners, as well as data consumers, such as Data Engineers and Analysts.Your main responsibilities will beInformation Architecture Design: Develop and maintain the RELEX' information architecture framework, including models, taxonomies, and metadataStrategy Alignment: Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure the architecture supports business objectives and aligns with data governance policiesDevelopment and maintenance of RELEX' common information model and glossary as an implementation independent target view for business informationUser-Centered Design: Create and maintain intuitive navigation structures for information retrieval and usability, keeping end-user needs in mindGovernance and Compliance: Establish standards and best practices for data management, ensuring compliance with regulations (e.g., GDPR, ISO 27001)Documentation and Communication: Produce clear documentation of architectures, workflows, and processes to support internal and external stakeholdersGuide value creation with an information centric approach, supporting the company in the topics in information management, information models, data models, master data management and data integrationCollaboration: Working closely with subject matter experts to design conceptual, logical and business process models; actively engage with development teams to implement models and guide specific technology and solution specific designsSystem Integration: Work with IT teams to design scalable information systems and ensure seamless integration between platforms and toolsContinuous Improvement: Assess and optimize existing information systems to improve efficiency, reduce redundancy, and enhance usabilityWhat you'll bring to the tableBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Enterprise Modeling, Information Systems, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus.Proven experience (5+ years) in information architecture, data modeling, or related roles.Technical skills:Proficiency in data modeling tools and techniquesExperience with databases (SQL and NoSQL), metadata management, and taxonomy developmentFamiliarity with cloud platforms and data integration technologiesProficiency in conceptual modeling tools and techniquesKnowledge of enterprise architecture frameworks (e.g., TOGAF, Zachman) is advantageousStrong analytical and problem-solving abilities.Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical stakeholdersAttention to detail and a proactive approach to identifying opportunities for improvementOur Helsinki officeRELEXians can be found around the world, but here we're based in Helsinki. We're passionate about using our technology to improve sustainability and change the world. Our office provides a great space for you to socialise, exercise and even take time out in our relaxing areas. We make sure our unique approach to flexibility and work-life balance comes across loud and clear; we're conveniently located, there's plenty of public transport and you can even bring your pet to the office!Across RELEX, our people are supported and rewarded.In Finland, we go even further. As well as:A competitive salaryFlexible and hybrid workingExtensive physical and wellbeing supportUp to 8 weeks of annual leave per yearA true hybrid-working policy (home and office)We also offer a range of benefits to support you, your family, and your life situation. We value your work-life balance and provide flexible hours with RELEX specific parental leave agreements. As we're a diverse team of smart, motivated and fun people, we also have an office gym, offer a mobile phone package and bike leasing.We're on a journey with our pioneering technology and exciting growth, which is why we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We can't wait to see what challenges you'll overcome and what problems you'll solve.Are you the one we're looking for? Apply today and become a part of our RELEX family!

title: Analyst Trainee Data Analytics Scsom
description: Haluaisitko päästä ratkomaan yhteiskuntamme merkityksellisimpiä ongelmia datalähtöisesti sosiaali- ja terveydenhuollon parissa?Etsimme nyt dataorientoitunutta tulevaisuuden lahjakkuutta 6 kuukauden trainee-jaksolle Turkuun. Trainee-jakson aloitus ajoittuu keväälle 2025.Nordic Healthcare Group on Pohjoismaiden johtava sosiaali- ja terveydenhuollon asiantuntijatalo. Autamme sosiaali- ja terveydenhuollon parissa toimivia asiakkaitamme menestymään ja onnistumaan yli 200 työntekijämme voimin. Asiakkaamme koostuvat julkisen sektorin toimijoista, kuten hyvinvointialueista ja kunnista, sekä yksityisen sektorin palveluntuottajista, sijoittajista ja lääketeollisuuden yrityksistä.Etsimme traineeta tiimiin, joka keskittyy hyvinvointialueille tarjottaviin kustannuslaskennan tuotteisiin ja palveluihin, sekä muihin talouden raportointiratkaisuihin. Asiakastyömme liittyvät usein esimerkiksi sote-palveluiden hinnoitteluun ja make-or-buy-kustannusten laskentaan, talouden seurannan dashboardien tuottamiseen, tai kustannuslaskentajärjestelmän käyttöönottoihin. Yhtenä tärkeimmistä tekemisen välineistämme on Power BI, jolla rakennamme asiakkaillemme visuaalisia raportointinäkymiä. Työskentelemme samassa liiketoimintayksikössä kuntapalveluita tarjoavan tiimin kanssa, jonka myötä traineella on erinomainen mahdollisuus päästä oppimaan myös kuntien taloudesta ja toiminnasta.Analyst traineena työnkuvaasi kuuluu esimerkiksi asiakkaidemme Power BI -raporttien ylläpitoa ja rakentamista, kustannuslaskentamallien luomista sekä asiakastapaamisiin osallistumista. Aiempaa kokemusta sosiaali- ja terveydenhuollon toimialalta emme sinulta edellytä, sillä uskomme, että meillä saat erinomaisen mahdollisuuden oppia toimialastamme lisää. Toimistomme sijaitsee aivan Turun keskustassa ja toivomme traineen työskentelevän noin kolme päivää viikossa toimistolla.Etsimällämme työkaverilla on...Kiinnostusta data-analytiikkaan ja tiedon visualisointiin sekä mahdollista aikaisempaa relevanttia työkokemustaErinomainen numeroiden lukutaito ja numerotarkkuutta, perustaidot BI-raporttien kehittämisestä (Power BI) sekä kiinnostusta kehittää omaa osaamistaHyvä tuntemus johdon laskentatoimesta esim. opintojen ja/tai työkokemuksen kauttaKandidaatin tutkinto ja loppusuoralla olevat maisterivaiheen opinnot sekä hyvä opintomenestys esimerkiksi kauppa- tai taloustieteiden alaltaAito kiinnostus päästä ratkomaan yhteiskuntamme merkityksellisimpiä ja vaikeimpia ongelmia sosiaali- ja terveydenhuollon parissaVahvat vuorovaikutus- ja yhteistyötaidotSuomen ja englannin kieli työkielinä, muu kielitaito (erityisesti skandinaaviset kielet) katsotaan eduksiMeillä NHG:llä...Pääset kehittämään osaamistasi monipuolisten projektien parissa osaavien kollegoiden tukemana - tarjoamme sinulle rutkasti oppia ja sopivasti haasteitaPääset osaksi tunnetusti loistavaa työyhteisöä ja avointa ilmapiiriä - meillä tehdään töitä asiantuntevasti, mutta pilke silmäkulmassaSaat tueksesi kannustavat ja iloiset työkaverit - meillä kollegoiden kanssa pääsee viettämään aikaa myös työn ulkopuolella, mm. tiimipäivien, urheilutempausten ja afterworkien muodossaSaat kilpailukykyisen palkan ja lounasedun käyttöösiInnostuitko? Laitathan CV:si, hakemuskirjeesi ja opintorekisteriotteesi meille viimeistään 19.3.2025 rekrytointijärjestelmämme kautta. Olethan kuitenkin nopea, käsittelemme hakemuksia jo hakuaikana ja täytämme tehtävän sopivan henkilön löydyttyä. Otamme vastaan hakemuksia vain rekrytointijärjestelmämme kautta.Rekrytointiprosessiin kuuluu kaksi haastattelua, jotka toteutetaan maalis-huhtikuun aikana. Trainee-jakson sujuessa hyvin, tarjoamme mielellämme mahdollisuuden työllistyä meille osa-aikaisesti opintojen ohelle ja kokoaikaiseksi analyytikoksi valmistumisen jälkeen.Odotamme innolla hakemustasi!

title: Senior Software Engineer All Genders Scsom
description: Senior Software Engineer (All Genders)Content Experiences (CXP) is a growing multi-disciplinary group of 100+ data scientists, engineers, business developers, product designers, and product managers in Helsinki and Berlin working to inspire each individual customer with meaningful fashion moments beyond transactions in a very personalised way.The Content Authoring sitting inside of CXP team is the bridge between content creators and Zalando customers. We thrive to create world class content to inspire and assist our customers, which helps them imagine and express their own individual style. We are now looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join our team based in Helsinki.INCLUSIVE BY DESIGNAt Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy: https://corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategyOur employee resource groups: https://corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groupsWHAT WE'D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)Build and operate a moderation system to check all content going to Zalando to ensure a safe environment for our usersTogether with your team, you will own your code and decide on the technologies and methods to deliver to help us build a stable tool for moderating content across systemsPerform code reviews, share knowledge and provide constructive feedback to team members.Actively participate in team discussions, design decisions and requirements clarifications with stakeholders and product managers.You keep learning and share your knowledge of state-of-the-art technologies that will help us innovate fasterWE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IFYou have solid knowledge of JVM based languages (Scala, Java, Kotlin), as well as NodeJS, willingness and interest in maintaining Scala services, and building Kotlin systems. You have knowledge of software patterns and paradigms like continuous integration, test automation and deployment pipelines.You have experience in specifying, planning, developing, maintaining and operating microservices using REST API (OpenAPI), GraphQL, Cloud Platforms (AWS, Kubernetes), PostgreSQL, DynamoDBExperience or interest in web frontend technologies (React) as well as GenAI (OpenAI) is a plus.High level knowledge or interest in data engineering and familiarity with DAGs, data pipelines, S3, Superset, Databricks, or Airflow is a plus.You have good communication and collaboration skills and enjoy working in an international and diverse environment with a positive no-job-is-beneath you attitude as a team playerYou are self-motivated and have a proactive mindset with a passion for continuous improvement.You have problem-solving skills and ability to apply logical and analytical thinking to complex problemsYou have worked in international, multicultural companies beforeOUR OFFERCentrally located and accessible office in Kamppi, Helsinki city center with diverse working and entertainment spaces and healthy snacks and drinks available.Hybrid work model of up to 60% remote work and flexible working times.40% Zalando shopping discount for employees, employee share shop, bike benefit, and Edenred benefits for lunch, sports and culture, commuting and massage.Extensive occupational health care and child care benefits.Additional holidays and volunteering time off.Supportive and active international community of colleagues for onboarding, mentoring, continued learning and for having fun through diverse offering of meet- ups and events, knowledge guilds and Employee Resource Groups with open source commitment.Relocation assistance for internationals.Learn all about Zalando and our values here: https://jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us. For more information about our office and teams in Helsinki, please visit: https://jobs.zalando.com/en/where-we-work/helsinkiPlease note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

title: Machine Learning Engineer Sfsor
description: As a Machine Learning Engineer at Fortum, you will develop cutting-edge AI solutions and contribute to a clean energy future. This is your chance to be part of a dynamic team that is passionate about leveraging data to drive innovations in sustainable energy. You will work on new projects, utilizing advanced analytics to solve complex problems and optimize energy solutions. Your work will directly impact our mission to create a cleaner world, and you will play a key role in shaping the future of energy. Join us and be part of something bigger.About the roleAt Fortum, we value creativity, collaboration, and the power of data-driven decision-making. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills in a supportive environment, with access to the latest tools and technologies. We offer competitive compensation packages, professional growth opportunities, and the satisfaction of knowing your efforts are contributing to a sustainable future for generations to come. If you are ready to make a difference and embrace the challenge of transforming the energy landscape, Fortum is the place for you. Join Fortum's Data Science & Optimization team to play a key role in our digitalization and AI journey. Together with a multi-disciplinary team of designers, developers, data scientists and testers, you will work with rapid digital experimentation to prove technical feasibility and usability of new AI use cases.Main responsibilities will include but not be limited to:Design and implement AI and ML solutions in Fortum's cloud environments (both Azure and AWS) that are robust, scalable, secure and cost-efficientDesign and automate stable MLOps pipelines with model re-trainingContribute to best practices development in AI solutions and MLOpsCommunicate with diverse stakeholders and understand the business needsDiscuss and design interfaces with backend and frontend teamsDiscuss requirements for storage and data maintenance protocols with DevOps, CloudOps, EA architecture and cybersecurity functionsCoach the team and be open to learn about the energy domainThe position can either be based in Sweden and Solna or Finland and Espoo.About youTo thrive in this role, you should have an MSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience. A strong background in Machine Learning and MLOps is essential, with at least three years of solid experience in software engineering using Python. You must also be proficient in statistics and data science, having spent a minimum of two years honing these skills. Experience working with cloud solutions, particularly Azure and/or AWS, for over two years is necessary. You should also have a keen interest in the latest AI developments.Experience with GenAI, cloud AI services, and different solution concepts (e.g. RAG, model fine-tuning, prompt engineering).Familiarity with GitHub Actions service deployment, containers and DevOps practices.Excellent communication skills and interest to learn about the energy domain.Full professional proficiency in written and oral English.Preferred additional experience includes:Data engineering; architecture development and deployment.IT security, high availability, cybersecurity, maintenance and support.Data storage and data maintenance methods.Familiarity with message brokers and microservice architectures.Basic knowledge of OCPP, MQTT, and IOT devices.Experience in working in an Agile environment.We offer youAt Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.Interested?Please submit your application by ****** at the latest. We will process the applications continually, and the position will be filled as soon as the right candidate is found, which may be before the last application deadline, so please apply as soon as possible.If you have any questions regarding the process or the position, please contact Kristofer Jakobsson, Head of Data Science & Optimization, *** be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance, as well as a health examination which may include a drug test.We are FortumFortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

description: Tehtävässäsi varmistat autojen taloudellisesti kannattavan jakautumisen Suomessa, koordinoit siirtoja sekä hallinnoit pysäköintilupia ja käyttöoikeuksia.Päätehtäväsi:-Luot, kehität ja seuraat autojen tuotto- ja sijaintiraportteja.-Analysoit kalustodataa ja ehdotat itsenäisesti parannuksia sijoitteluun tai hinnoitteluun.-Varmistat autojen saatavuuden palveluidemme välillä ja optimoit niiden maantieteellisen jakautumisen.-Toteutat pienempiä datankäsittely- tai raportointiprojekteja liiketoimintamme tueksi.Mitä odotamme sinulta:-Oma-aloitteisuutta, tarkkuutta ja intoa oppia uutta.-Sujuvaa suomen ja englannin kielen taitoa.-Kykyä suunnitella omaa työtä itsenäisesti ja toimia vastuullisena osana tiimiä.-Osaamista Excelissä ja SQL:ssä sekä kokemusta digitaalisista toimisto-ohjelmista.-Ongelmanratkaisukykyä ja innostusta tilastodataan näetkö sinä numeroissa mahdollisuuksia?-Kokemus autoalasta ei ole välttämätöntä meille tärkeintä on asenteesi, oppimiskykysi ja analyyttiset taitosi. title: Data Scientist Scsom
description: About us:Smartbi is a leading data and AI consultancy, helping businesses navigate the complex landscape of AI adoption and transformation. Our expertise spans end-to-end design and implementation of AI and advanced analytics solutions for enterprises - from opportunity assessments and solution design to full-scale AI implementation. As organizations seek to harness the potential of data and AI, we are looking to grow our core team of skilled Data Scientists.About the role:As a Data Scientist at Smartbi, you will drive innovation by developing and deploying advanced machine learning models and data-driven solutions to solve real-world problems for our industrial clients. You will work closely with data engineers, project managers, and clients to deliver predictive analytics that optimize business operations.Key responsibilities:Build and deploy machine learning models for various industrial use cases.Analyze and process large datasets to generate actionable insights.Collaborate with a wide variety of stakeholders to ensure succesfull implementation.Communicate complex data results and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Contribute to improving ways of working for our clients, ensuring AI and data-centric solutions are seamlessly integrated into their daily operations.What we offer:The opportunity to work on challenging AI projects with tangible real-world impact across industries, collaborating with multinational clients.A supportive and innovative working environment that invests in your professional development.Flexible working environment - regarding remote work, for instance.International team and projects (we have offices in Finland and the US).Strong sense of community in our team, with a range of events and activities to join.Minimum of 3 years of experience in data science or machine learning.Strong analytical and mathematical understanding.Proficiency in Python, SQL, and experience with Azure cloud platform.Experience with machine learning and data science tools such as Pandas, NumPy, PyTorch.Familiarity with APIs, Git, and good coding practices.Skills in data visualization using tools like Matplotlib and Seaborn.Strong understanding of MLOps concepts.Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a dynamic environment.Fluency in English; Finnish is a plus.

title: Senior Solutions Architect Aws Ags Emea Field North Scsom
description: Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate? Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Finland and empower large enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. Solutions Architects are responsible for creating and presenting technical content and sharing best practices.They work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. They help customers validate their initiatives from ideation to proof of concept. Solutions Architects lead activities such as architecture reviews, white-boarding sessions, demos and technical workshops. They collaborate with other teams such as account management, professional services, industry experts, support, service teams and the AWS partner ecosystem.Amongst others you will be part of design and building reference architectures, proof of concepts and deploying workloads on AWS. Deliver thought leadership and recommendations on cloud architecture, migration, modernization and operation. Build strong technical relationships acting as the voice of the customer internally to influence AWS service roadmaps.Come build the future with us.AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.About the teamDiverse ExperiencesAWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn't followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don't let it stop you from applying.Why AWS?Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.Inclusive Team CultureAWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.Mentorship & Career GrowthWe're continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth's Best Employer. That's why you'll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.Work/Life BalanceWe value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there's nothing we can't achieve.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS- Background in Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps across industries.- Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience- Experience in managing complex sales processes with both technical and non-technical stakeholders- Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges- English business level communication skills written and verbalPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS- Computer Science or Maths background highly desired- Working knowledge of software development practices and technologies highly desired- AWS Certification, eg. AWS Solutions Architect Associate- Finnish or Estonian business level communication skills written and verbalAmazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice ( https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page ) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you're applying in isn't listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Senior Tech Lead Data Platform Sfsor
description: Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers' increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.We are looking for talented and passionate individuals to join our Secure Operations & Data Solutions team! This role involves leading the Data Platform Team in DCO. You will be responsible for the data platform that supports multiple data domains, providing a unified governance solution for all data and AI assets, including files, tables, machine learning models, and dashboards in the Consumer Solutions' Databricks Lakehouse Platform & Gen AI (Data Intelligence Platforms). You will actively contribute to data democratization across Consumer Solutions and Fortum. Your role is to understand changes in markets, competition, technology, and customer behavior and turn them into decisions and execution that support all our teams to succeed. Our team is committed to pursuing innovation and improvements through increased use of data. United by our passion for technology, curiosity about user experience, and dedication to excellence, we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.In this role, you will:Leading the data engineering team and collaborate with business stakeholders to ensure successful project delivery.Ensure technical excellence, using the right tools and technologies to support the team to deliver faster.Be responsible for overall system availability and compliance.Manage and coach team performance and wellbeing.Manage systems, licenses, budget, costs, and technology roadmap within the team scope.Ensure that the solutions follow Fortum policies and guidelines regarding architecture, development practices, privacy, security, etc.Collect functional and non-functional, security, compliance, and availability requirements from business units.This position can be located in either Espoo, Oslo, Kristiansand, Solna or Gothenburg. At Fortum, we apply a hybrid working model. Read more about other job opportunities, our projects and what we offer here!To excel in this role, you are expected to be:A bachelor's or master's degree holder in computer science, business administration, or another relevant area.Experienced in IT and function/business/industry.Experienced in leading teams.Experienced in SQL, Python, and data pipeline tools.Knowledge on Azure data tools like data factory, databricks, datalake is a plus.Maintaining role-based competence and training regularly.We are excited to hire an individual who is passionate about data platforms and eager to contribute to our innovative team. If you share our enthusiasm, we would love to hear from you!Ready to Join Us?Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 20.03.2025 at the latest.We work with an ongoing selection and the job ad might be closed before the final application date. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Antti Heimonen by phone or via email at ***. We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you!To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.We are FortumFortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Azure Data Consultants Snsig
description: 🚀 Unlock Your Next Career Move with Our Growing Data Team! 🚀A company with over 20 years of experience, growing faster than ever. The Data Team, established under the leadership of an experienced team lead in 2021, has grown to 40 people and is rapidly expanding. We are focused on Azure-based analytics, and with a pipeline full of exciting projects, we need passionate, innovative professionals to join us!🔍 What we're looking for:* 4+ years of experience as a Data Engineer focused on Azure Fabric, Databricks, DBT (Snowflake experience also considered)* Ideally, a Full Stack Data Engineer with expertise in DW, ETL, Data Modeling, and tools like Power BI - we'll consider backend-heavy profiles who are eager to work on the frontend when needed* Open-minded consultants who are excited to work with new tech and flexible on tools* Fluency in Finnish is a must💼 Why join?* Flat hierarchy - A family feel where decisions are made together. Work closely with an experienced team lead and a team of consultants on cutting-edge Azure projects* New, innovative projects with clients across all industries, generating €40M+ in revenue* Excellent salary & benefits with plenty of room for growth* Comprehensive training & certification opportunities - even if you're new to Azure, we'll support you in learning and growing* No legacy customers - All our work is cloud-based with the latest Azure technologies* Flexible working hours and a supportive work-life balance* Customer satisfaction rating of 4.6/5 consistently year on year!* Social & fun team culture - group outings, football games, and drinks with colleagues and customers (check out our fun team costumes on LinkedIn!)If you're looking for a dynamic and innovative team that values your expertise, fosters your growth, and offers exciting career opportunities, this is your chance! We're ready to expand and need talented Data Engineers to help us win and deliver even bigger projects this year.

title: Power Bi Consultant Snsig
description: Power BI ConsultantAre you passionate about data analytics and visualization? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where you can help businesses unlock the power of their data? If so, I have an exciting opportunity for you!My client is a rapidly growing consulting firm specializing in data and analytics solutions. Their mission is to help businesses across various industries leverage data-driven insights to enhance decision-making, improve efficiency, and drive innovation. As part of their expansion, they are looking for a talented Power BI Consultant to join the data team.Key Responsibilities:*Design, develop, and maintain Power BI reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights.*Work closely with clients to understand their business requirements and translate them into data solutions.*Optimize data models and visualizations to ensure efficiency and scalability.*Implement best practices for data visualization, data storytelling, and user experience.*Integrate Power BI with various data sources, including databases, cloud platforms, and APIs.*Provide training and support to clients on Power BI usage and best practices.*Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, business analysts, and industry experts.Requirements:*Proven experience in developing Power BI dashboards and reports.*Strong knowledge of DAX, Power Query, and data modelling.*Familiarity with SQL and relational databases.*Experience working with cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud is a plus.*Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.*Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.*Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.*Fluency in Finnish and English is a must.What They Offer:*A dynamic and supportive work environment with opportunities for career growth.*Exposure to cutting-edge projects in the field of data analytics and digital transformation.*Flexible working arrangements with a mix of remote and office-based work.*Competitive salary and benefits package.*The chance to work with a talented team of data professionals on impactful projects.If you are ready to take your career in Power BI consulting to the next level and work on exciting data-driven projects, I would love to hear from you!How to Apply: Send your CV outlining your experience and motivation for the role. Any further questions, contact me on ****** or ***

title: Ai Principal Sssii
description: IMPACT DRIVEN, AI POWEREDJoin us at the forefront of the AI revolution. Our mission is to lead the transition towards a future where AI amplifies human potential, ensuring ethical and impactful use of technology!Our strategy is centered around three key areas:Staying on the cutting edge with the latest technical innovations, like Generative AI, which are set to transform our society in unprecedented ways, while continually developing our competencies.Transforming our own ways of working, focusing on reinventing the value chain and commercial models of software development through AI.Strengthening our ability to envision impactful and ethical Data & AI solutions for our customers to maximize our influence.AI PRINCIPALAs a Principal, you will be responsible for developing Siili's AI offerings, leading go-to-market activities, and acting as a trusted advisor for our customers. You will also inspire our own experts and act as a thought leader in AI.The specific skills we are seeking are:Broad understanding of various traditional and generative AI solutions, and the ability to identify business use cases while articulating business impact to stakeholders.Practical hands-on experience creating AI solutions, ideally from a data science or similar background, to provide practical implementation advice.Understanding of MLOps, related solutions, and/or data engineering.LIFE AS AI PRINCIPAL AT SIILIAs AI Principal, your day-to-day responsibilities will include:Developing your own offering and building external visibility through blog posts, public presentations, etc.Meeting customers, presenting Siili's perspectives, and generating leads.Collaborating with Siili's account managers to create sales pitches and proposals.Providing advisory services to our customers and overseeing project deliveries.Typically, your time will be split 50/50 between commercial/pre-sales and billable customer work.We believe that we can best help you build your story when you have:Strong business acumen and a clear understanding of how data and technology innovations create business value and competitive advantages for our customers.A curious mind and a deep understanding of the trends within your offering area.Exceptional communication skills in both conversation and writing, with an emphasis on pitching and delivering inspiring presentations.WHAT WE OFFERA supportive team environment: We uplift each other, treat everyone with respect, and strive to make each other better in all that we do.A community to grow, learn, and mentor: We invest in your skills development, and our combined design agency and tech powerhouse will help you stay at the cutting edge of the industry.Competitive compensation and benefits: We offer not only competitive pay but also additional perks like hobby clubs, daycare services for sick children.A profitable, growing company with a purpose: We have a clear vision and purpose, and a unique opportunity for you to make your mark as we shape the Data & AI story for a leading IT services company.If you're ready to be part of something transformative and impactful, we'd love to hear from you!WHY SIILI?At Siili, we're a community with a culture built on Joy, Ambition, and a Humane touch. We continuously organize activities and gatherings, enabling exciting projects with opportunities for learning, while fostering an inclusive and psychologically safe environment for everyone to express themselves.As a Siili, you'll work alongside the best colleagues on interesting client projects. We're committed to continuous growth, which means there are always opportunities for you to deepen your expertise while collaborating with Fullstack experts. We trust you to manage your own work while also contributing to diverse teams.We lead the charge in innovative projects that make a real-world impact, ensuring that AI is not just a tool but a transformative force in everything we do. We invest in the skills of each Siili through various paths of AI learning, certifications, and other development opportunities.We also offer an extensive range of great benefits, including healthcare, flexible working hours, in-house coaching, the SiiliX Share program, an employee bike benefit, and company-sponsored massage sessions. For a closer look at our vibrant company culture, we recommend following us on Instagram.READY TO "MAKE IT REAL"?At Siili, we don't conduct interviews; we have meetings. These meetings ensure that both our goals and expectations are aligned, laying the foundation for a promising future together.We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds, including different ages, genders, cultures, and minority groups.Please let us know if we can adapt our meeting to suit your needs. We strive to consider individual needs and neurodiversity in our recruitment process, making meetings as comfortable as possible for everyone.Apply today, and join us on this exciting journey!

title: Quantitative Senior Business Analyst For Nordea Finance Recovery Data Snsor
description: Would you like to play a key role in shaping the way credit risk recovery data is sourced in Nordea Finance? We are now looking for a Senior Business Analyst to understand business processes, design and implement data flows, and coordinate with other analysts and developers.The role requires both technical hands-on work and coordination with stakeholders. There is ample opportunity to take ownership and grow as the project develops, so we encourage both experienced and budding senior analysts to apply.At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast - and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That's why we're deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We're creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together - and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you'll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.About this opportunityWelcome to the Credit Risk Data Analytics team within Nordea Finance. We add value by enabling data driven credit risk management across the Nordics and across the product landscape of Nordea Finance.As a Senior Business Analyst, you'll play a valuable role in integrating Nordea Finance into the Nordea Groups centralized risk modelling, as we are modernizing the way recovery data is sourced.Credit risk models is a key priority for NF and the Nordea Group. Ensuring a robust and correct data foundation is a core aspect of the overall project and a non-trivial challenge.You will be a key person in analyzing requirements from Group Risk Models, understanding business processes and their representation in data, designing data flows and data quality monitoring, and interacting with IT architects and developers for the long term automation of recovery data sourcing. The initiative is evolving over the coming years and your skills and ideas will help shape our direction.What you'll be doing:Take ownership of and collaborate with other data analysts in maintaining and updating as-is data models and flows built in Python and SQLWork with other Credit Risk Management analysts and leaders in coordinating automation of recovery data sourcingAnalyse and understand our products and processes and how they are represented in legacy data modelsCreate robust and comprehensive integration of our data landscape with canonical data models of recovery dataCoordinate productionisation of prototypes with IT architects and developersBecome a subject matter expert in recovery data in Nordea Finance and act as a stakeholder towards both the local business and the groupYou'll join a diverse team in terms of age, experience, nationality and gender, situated across the Nordics. The role can be based in any of the Nordic capitals.Who you areCollaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best - and that we imagine you share with us.To succeed in this role, we believe that you:Have strong analytical skills - being able to understand complex processes and dataTake ownership of your work and are able to drive it independentlyAre analytical, methodical and structured with an eye for detailHave strong communication and collaboration skillsAre open and curious - seeking to learn and develop your skills and toolsetYour experience and background:Degree in a relevant field like economics, finance or other technical field (mathematics, physics, computer science, engineering, etc.)Experience with credit risk recovery data, for instance as a credit risk model analyst, as an analyst in a collection agency or from similar functions in the financial industry.Experience with SQL and PythonExperience with IT coordination would be a plusExcellent English, as this is our primary working languageIf this sounds like you, get in touch!Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 02/02/2025 . For more information, you're welcome to contact Tobias Sommer Thune on *** Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.Read more about working at Nordea here

title: Business Data Analyst With Product Owner Experience Group Credit Management Snsor
description: Would you like to be part of a Nordic team, developing the future credit processes for our customers? We are now looking for Credit Risk Business / Data Analysts to our High Risk Data & Default Management Team.We are offering you an exciting opportunity to develop key capabilities at the heart of Nordea. Your work will require you to understand the connection between regulatory requirements, business processes and data to pro-actively drive initiatives and solve complex problems connected to Nordea's Credit Risk process.About this opportunityWelcome to the High Risk Capability team. We are a growing team, driving the development for high risk credit processes (such as default management and early warnings). Our aim is to build sustainable processes and supporting tools that cater for automation through which we enable great customer experiences. You will work closely with team members and relevant stakeholders to drive the implementation of new solutions and processes for business, regulatory and data requirements.What you'll be doing:Building expertise of Nordea's credit risk agenda, especially within high riskBe part of an agile structure, with focus on defining, prioritizing and driving analysis and change initiatives from initiation to successful delivery, in close collaboration with development teams, relevant stakeholders and managementEnsuring our solutions meet business and regulatory requirements and maximize business valueIdentifying and actively proposing improvements to streamline the end to end credit processes and enable automation in the areaYou'll join a diverse, multi-faceted and passionate team. Occasional travel primarily in the Nordics should be expected. The location can be either in Sweden, Finland, Norway or Denmark.Who you areCollaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best - and that we imagine you share with us.Your experience and background:At least 3-5 years of experience working with data analysis and / or regulations and business processes within credit risk, preferably within high riskAs a business analyst you have experience driving change (from gathering business / regulatory requirements to implementation) in an agile environment. You also are strong in documenting and conceptualising requirements in complex environmentsFurthermore, you have experience working with and understanding credit risk related regulations, for example the Capital Requirements Regulation, EBA guideline on the definition of default or similarAs a data analyst you naturally have a passion for data, working independently with data analysis to produce actionable outcomes with key insights for stakeholdersHave a professional level of English, both written and spokenHave excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, building strong relationships with stakeholders across Business and ITTo succeed in the role, we believe that you:Can effectively deliver and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environmentAre self-going with a natural "can do" attitude, show ability to learn quickly and have a solution-oriented mindset supported by structured, analytical and creative thinkingIf this sounds like you, get in touch!Next stepsSubmit your application no later than 31/01/2025. For more information, you're welcome to contact Matthew Woodward, *** or ******.At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.Only for candidates in Sweden:For union information, please contact *** or *** more about working at Nordea here

title: Vp Engineering Data Scsom
description: Upright is a rapidly growing impact data company on a mission to make it financially more attractive to run a net positive company than a net negative one. From the very beginning of 2017, we have been committed to highlighting what truly matters in corporate sustainability, producing data on companies' real-world impacts that's backed by science, comparable, and credible to inform better decision-making for companies, investors, customers, and beyond.Today, our Net Impact Platform is an exceptional resource - it's the world's largest open-access database on company and fund impact with data on 10,000+ companies and 35,000+ funds publicly available for anyone to explore. As impact data becomes increasingly central in business decision-making, Upright's data is trusted by 250+ institutional investment organizations and corporations, predominantly in Europe and North America. And this is just the beginning of our journey.We are now on the lookout for an experienced VP of Engineering (Data) who is ready and excited to take on the challenge of making Upright's impact data the world's leading impact resource. Your mission will be to drive the coverage, quality, relevance, and transparency of our impact data, ensuring that it becomes the go-to source for understanding companies' real-world impact.As the VP of Engineering (Data), you will lead Upright's data function, overseeing multiple teams responsible for developing our key datasets. You'll work with talented software engineers, data scientists, machine learning experts, and data analysts. Together, you'll push the boundaries of how our data can be used to measure impact at scale.SIGNS OF BEING A GREAT MATCH FOR THIS ROLE INCLUDE:Solid experience in leading high-performing engineering teamsComprehensive understanding of the whole software lifecycle including design, development, deployment, and operationsOverall understanding of modern data science and data engineering technologies, including data/ETL pipelinesHands-on experience in developing high-quality software with Typescript and PythonGood command of (Postgre)SQLAbility to understand complex data structuresAbility to think analytically, structure your work, and solve problems proactivelyAbility to communicate complex ideas clearly both verbally and in writingA proven track record of exceeding expectations, driven by an internal passion for excellenceA sense of urgency and the drive to get things doneStrong common-sense reasoning ability coupled with the ability to prioritize work effectivelyWHAT WE OFFER:A chance to join a quickly growing and highly ambitious impact SaaS company with a mission that mattersA fun and kind team with exceptional people who care about what they doExciting professional growth opportunitiesCompetitive compensation, including stock options and a comprehensive healthcare packageLocation: Helsinki, Finland.Deadline: Candidates will be reviewed on a continuous basis and the role will be filled as soon as the right person is found.>MISSION THAT MATTERSUpright is on a mission to incentivize companies to optimize their net impact by enabling science-based decision-making for investors, customers, employees, and public sector agents. To do that, Upright develops a proprietary data model based on an open-access database of 200M+ scientific articles and artificial intelligence to quantify the net impact of companies on people, planet, society, and knowledge creation. In addition to net impact, Upright produces data on UN SDG alignment, EU taxonomy, and EU SFDR PAI indicators. Currently, our impact data platform is used by 250+ institutional investors and companies, such as Nasdaq, Nordea, EQT and Nokia.If you have any questions, please email us at ***.

title: Freelancer Useita Rooleja Sgsof
description: Gofore on kansainvälinen digitaalisen muutoksen konsulttiyhtiö. Meillä on lähes 1 500 asiantuntijaa kaikkiaan 18 toimipisteessä Suomessa, Saksassa, Itävallassa, Virossa ja Espanjassa. Teknologian ja liiketoiminnan asiantuntijamme rakentavat toimivaa, turvallista ja yhdenvertaista digitaalista yhteiskuntaa palveluineen sekä kestäviä älykkään teollisuuden ratkaisuja. Monimuotoista osaajajoukkoamme yhdistävät pioneerihenkisyys sekä halu luoda inhimillisempää ja vastuullisempaa digimaailmaa. Toimintaamme ohjaavat vahvat arvomme: olemme jokaiselle hyvä työpaikka, ja elämme asiakkaidemme onnistumisista. Liikevaihtomme vuonna 2024 oli 186,2 miljoonaa euroa. Gofore Oyj:n osake on listattu Nasdaq Helsinki Oy:ssä. Visiomme on olla merkittävin eurooppalainen digitaalisen muutoksen asiantuntijayritys.Lisätietoja Goforesta työnantajana löydät halutessasiliity joukkoon-jakulttuurisivuiltamme.Goforelaisena freelancerina tarjoamme sinulle mahdollisuuden päästä osaksi mielenkiintoisia projekteja, jotka kehittävät ammatillista osaamistasi. Projektitarjontamme on laaja, ja kattaa erilaisia tehtäviä niin julkisen, kuin yksityisenkin sektorin kentistä, joissa toimimme molemmissa arvostettuna kumppanina asiakkaillemme. Liity joukkoomme freelancerina rakentamaan yhdenvertaisempaa, eettisempää ja kestävämpää digimaailmaa, ja vie asiakasprojektiemme myötä osaamisesi seuraavalle tasolle!Mitä odotamme sinultaEtsimme freelancereita eri rooleihin kuten esimerkiksi ohjelmistoarkkitehti, tekninen projektipäällikkö, Data Engineer, pilviasiantuntija tai Power Platform -osaaja. Sinulla voi olla kokemusta esimerkiksi ohjelmistokehityksestä, arkkitehtuurisuunnittelusta, vaatimusmäärittelystä, projektijohtamisesta, pilvipalveluista, Data & AI -kehityksestä tai Power Platform -ratkaisuista. Projekteissamme on käytössä muun muassa seuraavat teknologiat: .NET, Java, Spring Boot, Node.js, JavaScript, Typescript, React, Azure, AWS & SQL.Jottamenestyt asiakasprojekteissamme, toivomme sinulta:Olet toiminut aiemmin freelancerina asiakasprojekteissaOmaat kattavan kokemuksen konsulttina monitoimittajaympäristöissä toimimisestaItseohjautuvuutta ja ratkaisukeskeistä asennettaHyviä kommunikointitaitoja: kommunikoit ratkaisuehdotuksiasi itsevarmasti ja rakentavastiVähintään 5+ vuotta kokemusta laajoista asiakastoimeksiannoistaFreelancer-prosessimmeTunnistitko kuvauksesta itsesi, ja etsit nyt haastavia ja merkityksellisiä projekteja, joissa pääset loistamaan? Jätä meille hakemus alla olevasta lomakkeesta, niin olemme sinuun yhteydessä pian.

title: Senior Data Ai Consultant Julkishallinnon Ja Terveydenhuollon Projekteihin Sfsut
description: Hae meidän tiimiin!Generatiivisen tekoälyn muuttaessa tapaa, jolla työskentelemme ja mitä teemme asiakkaidemme kanssa, etsimme nyt uusia kollegoita, jotka ovat kiinnostuneita tästä alasta. Pelkästään viime vuonna olemme toteuttaneet yli 25 GenAI-projektia useilla eri aloilla. Olemme eturintamassa hyödyntämässä tekoälyä liiketoiminnan muutoksessa ja olemme saaneet tunnustusta arvostetuissa julkaisuissa, kuten Helsingin Sanomat ja Taloussanomat. Olemme julkaisseet yli60 GenAI:n käyttötapaa julkisella sektorilla, jonka toteutimme yhdessä arvovaltaisten asiakkaidemme kanssa.TehtävästäTulet työskentelemään julkishallinnon ja terveydenhuoltoalan asiakkuuksissa, joissa projektien vaikuttavuus ja merkityksellisyys puhuvat puolestaan. Tarkka roolisi voidaan muokata osaamisesi ja henkilökohtaisten kiinnostusten perusteella, mutta se koostuu pääasiassa seuraavista osa-alueista:Suunnittelet, toteutat ja tuotannollistat edistyksellisiä tekoälyratkaisuja, erikoistuen usein generatiiviseen tekoälyyn, jonka avulla voidaan käsitellä monimutkaisia liiketoiminnan haasteita.Teet töitä monialaisten tiimien kanssa ja osallistut tekoälykäyttötapojen kehittämiseen, jotka tuovat todellista arvoa käyttäjille.Otat projekteissa liidaavan roolin ja toimit asiakkaan luottohenkilönä. Lisäksi sparraat ja mentoroit muita AI:n parissa, edistäen innovaatioita.Tuet myyntitiimiämme hyödyntämällä teknistä osaamistasi asiakkaan menestyksen tukemiseksi ja hankkeiden edistämiseksi.Kokretisoidaksemme mitä etsimme tiimimme jaamme sinulle vielä toivelistamme. Emme odota, että täytät nämä kaikki toiveet, mutta katsomme ne ehdottomasti eduksi tässä haussa.Aikaisempi kokemus tekoälyn ja koneoppimisen onnistuneesta käyttöönotosta käytännön ratkaisuihin.Laajat ohjelmointitaidot, erityisesti kielillä kuten Python, sekä kokemusta työskentelystä tekoälymallien kuten GPT tai Llama2 kanssa.Muut datahankkeisiin liittyvät taidot kuten data engineering tai MLOps.Näytöt tekoäly-/koneoppimisratkaisujen arkkitehtuurisuunnittelusta ja kokemusta tieto- ja tekoälytyökaluista suosituilla pilvipalvelualustoilla erityisesti Azurella ja/tai AWSllä.Kokemus konsultointi- tai neuvonantajaroolista, kyky kääntää monimutkaiset tekoälykonseptit konkreettisiksi ratkaisuiksi.Arvostat hyvää viestintää, sekä tiimin että asiakkaiden kanssa. Puhut sujuvasti Suomea ja Englantia.Toimialaosaamista julkiselta sektorilta ja terveydenhuollon alaltaAsianmukaisten sertifikaattien omistaminen pilviteknologiasta tai tekoälystä.Koulutustausta tietojenkäsittelytieteessä tai siihen liittyvillä aloilla yhdistettynä vähintään kolmen vuoden työkokemukseen datan parissa.Kotitoimistosi on Helsingissä tai Tampereella. Työskentelemme joustavasti hybridinä. Projektien osalta työskentely sovitaan asiakaskohtaisesti. Osa projekteista painottuu etätyöskentelyyn ja toisaalta työ voi edellyttää jonkin verran satunnaista läsnätyötä asiakasorganisaatioissa. Tehtävä on vakituinen ja kokoaikainen.Tuleva tiimisi odottaaPublic & Health- yksikkömmepalvelee asiakkaitamme eri julkisen sektorin aloilla, mukaan lukienterveydenhuolto, hallinto, koulutus, kaupungit ja muut julkiset palvelut. Tiimimme tehtävänä on auttaa julkista sektoria tuottavuuden ja vaikuttavuuden kasvattamisessa. Teemme muutosta dataa ja uutta teknologiaa hyödyntäen, toiminnan uudelleenmuotoiluun yhdistäen. Johdamme muutosta yksilötasolta koko yhteisöjen ja julkisten organisaatioiden tasolle käytännönläheisesti. Tarjoamme laajan valikoiman mahdollisuuksia vaikuttaa ja jättää jälkesi julkisten organisaatioiden ja palveluiden kehittämiseen - eli todella vaikuttaa meidän kaikkien jokapäiväiseen elämään!Public & Health tiimissämme on lähes 70 ammattilaista, ja yhdistämme laajan joukon asiantuntemusta ja kattavan tietämyksen julkisesta sektorista. Pystyt omilla teoillasi vaikuttamaan siihen, miten toimimme, sillä kehitämme jatkuvasti toimintamallejamme ja siksi arvostamme myös rakentavaa palautetta ja kehitysehdotuksia.Futurice tarjoaa sinulleTarjoamme innostavan ja kehittävän työympäristön. Ketterä ja matalahierarkinen organisaatiomme tukee kasvuasi ammattilaisena. Tavoitteenamme on olla uraasi tukeva alusta ja tarjota mahdollisuuksia oppimiseen ja taitojen laajentamiseen. Työskentelet motivoituneiden, monitaitoisten osaajien kanssa kehityksessä, suunnittelussa ja strategiassa.Voit tutustua meidän Senior Data Architect Markus Koposenvideoon tästä, jossa hän kertoo urapolustaan ja työskentelystä Futuricella.Lisäksi tässä muutamia etuja, joita tarjoamme:Futuricen hybridityömalliVapaavalintaiset työvälineetUrheilu- ja lounasetuFuturicen kerhot vapaa-ajan aktiviteetteja vartenOppimistapahtumatSertifiointi-ohjelmaHakuohjeetKuulostaako tämä juuri sinulle sopivalta seuraavalta askeleelta urallasi? Siinä tapauksessa odotamme innolla että pääsemme kuulemaan sinusta lisää! Hae tähän rooliin lataamalla hakemuksesi hakujärjestelmäämme klikkaamalla Apply-painiketta.Hakulomakkeemme on nopea ja helppo täyttää: lisää vain yhteystietosi ja lataa liitteeksi hakudokumenttisi. Hakudokumenteiksi toivomme CV:tä ja hakemuskirjettä, jossa kuulemme mielellämme lisää sinusta, urastasi, kiinnostuksen kohteistasi ja miksi kiinnostuit tästä roolista Futuricella! Voit halutessasi myös lisätä mukaan linkin LinkedIn-profiiliisi ja jakaa muita tärkeäksi katsomiasi liitteitä.Käsittelemme hakemuksia saapumisjärjestyksessä. Rekrytointiprosessiimme kuuluu useampi haastattelu, jotka voidaan pitää etänä tai toimistollamme Helsingin keskustassa.Ensimmäisessä haastattelussa tarkoituksena on tutustua, keskustella kokemuksestasi, osaamisestasi ja kiinnostuksen kohteistasi ja kertoa lisää meidän roolista ja arjesta Futuricella. Toisessa haastattelussa sukellamme vielä syvemmälle ammatilliseen osaamiseesi ja kokemukseesi, ja rekrytointiprosessin loppuvaiheessa keskustelemme lisää mahdollisista projekteista, joihin uusi tiimikaveri voisi hypätä! Tarkoituksena on, että läpi rekrytointiprosessin pääset tutustumaan useampaan tulevaan kollegaan ja saat monipuolisen käsityksen roolista, vastuistasi, odotuksista ja siitä, millainen työarki sinua mahdollisesti odottaa Futuricella!Mikäli sinulla on kysymyksiä rooliin liittyen, voit olla yhteydessärecruitment@futurice.comPalkkauksestaPalkkaukseen liittyvät yksityiskohdat käydään läpi yksityiskohtaisesti rekrytointiprosessin aikana. Palkkaviitekehyksemme on suunniteltu tarjoamaan erilaisia uratasoja, jotka perustuvat kolmeen tekijään: taidot, vastuut ja roolin vaikuttavuus. Olemme omistautuneet luomaan yhdenvertaisen ja tukevan työympäristön, jossa jokaisella työntekijällä on mahdollisuus menestyä ja edetä urallaan sekä tulla paremmiksi versioiksi itsestään.Ensimmäisellä haastattelukierroksella keskustelemme tämän tehtävän palkkahaarukasta. Tarjoamme kiinteää palkkaa, johon sisältyy mahdollisuus suoritusperusteisiin bonuksiin ja lisäetuihin.Olemme Futurice, tuloksiin keskittynyt digitaalisen muutoksen tekijä.Autamme asiakkaitamme ratkaisemaan merkittävimmät ongelmansa ja löytämään tapoja vaikuttaa maailmaan positiivisesti. Meillä on uniikki organisaatiokulttuuri ja vahvat arvot: luottamus, läpinäkyvyys, välittäminen ja jatkuva kehittyminen. Yhteisömme on loistava alusta kehittymiselle ja tarjoamme kattavat oppimis- ja kouluttautumismahdollisuudet, mahdollistaen ammatillisen ja henkilökohtaisen kasvun kaikille. Toimintaamme ohjaa selkeät monimuotoisuustavoitteet ja eettiset toimintaperiaatteet. Meillä saat inspiraatiota erilaisista näkökulmista: jokainen futuricelainen yksilöllisellä tarinallaan tuo oman jälkensä monimuotoiseen kulttuuriimme.Vuonna 2000 perustetussa yrityksessämme työskentelee noin 800 monipuolisista taustoista ponnistavaa asiantuntijaa yli 60:stä eri maasta. Juuremme ovat Pohjoismaissa, asenteemme globaali ja toimimme ympäri Eurooppaa.
